dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Hey. I have some bad news.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: The delays on the Agena? I don’t think we'll lose much time. Puts the pressure on Dave and me, but --

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Neil. Sees it’s something else.  53.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Elliot and Charlie were flying into Lambert. Their plane... they crashed on approach. Neil takes this in. Knowing from the look on Ed’s face th neither Elliot nor Charlie made it. The two of them stand there in AWFUL SILENCE. Nothing to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil walks back in. Sits down at the table.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: So are they going to make the new Agena better? Dad? Neil looks over at Rick. Lost.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Are they going to make the new Agena better? So it doesn’t explode?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Uh, yes. I’m, I’m sure they... Neil trails off, clearly elsewhere. Janet intercedes.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Ricky, go get your math homework so I can check. Rick nods, heads off to his room. Janet glances over at M playing with his peas, then quietly leans over to Neil.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Who was it?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Elliot. Janet pales. CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gray, rainy. SIX BLACK HORSES pull a caisson bearing a FL DRAPED COFFIN into Section 4 of the famous cemetery, TWO PLATOONS and a COLOR GUARD alongside.  54. The horses stop. The Navy men lift the coffin and carry i past a 9-YEAR-OLD GIRL. In tears. The girl, Elliot’s daughter, stands with Marilyn and Elliot's other children .-..-but we HOLD ON her as she watches the casket pass an burying her face in ED’S OVERCOAT. Ed puts an arm around fighting it himself, holding on to Pat and looking over a Janet and Neil. Who’s BLANK. His face devoid of emotion, features FROZEN... save for HIS EYES. DARTING from the coffin... to the CRANK by the grave... to Elliot's daught And for a moment, she looks just like Neil’s daughter Kar PUSH IN on Neil’s eyes and MATCH CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, staring down at a SEXTANT. He turns it in his hands

dialogues.speaker: PETE CONRAD, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Wouldja believe Mondale cornered me at Arlington? Senator thought it was a good time to ask why we don’t just send machines to the moon? PULL BACK to a circle of astronauts nearby. Conrad, Lovel Scott and others pass a bottle of vodka, a lime inside.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: Shit. How the hell did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: JIM LOVELL
dialogues.text: Cernan told me the cloud cover was down to 500 feet. A low go-around underneath low clouds, that’s tough. Probably never saw the building.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Clearly, the error was the approach. Conrad glances at Buzz Aldrin. Even he’s taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: The T-38 stalls below 270 knots. He wasn’t aggressive enough. The men go quiet. Buzz may be right, but it’s not the tim Uneasy, they look away... save for Neil. Who STARES at Bu

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: What? Tell me you disagree. Neil does. But he just turns, walks into --  55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, tense, moves through the gathered mourners, eyes darting, SEARCHING for Janet. We CUT INTO NEIL’S POV -- -..eyes ticking past WIVES raising hands in greeting... .--.past ED waving, calling to Neil from across the room. .-.-pausing on ELLIOT’S PHOTO on the mantle... Neil KEEPS GOING until he spots Janet. He moves SWIFTLY i INT. KITCHEN, ELLIOT AND MARILYN SEE’S HOUSE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet lays cookies out on a tray. Neil rolls up beside he

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I told Pat I’d help put out dessert.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: (quiet) I need to go.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Okay. It’ll just be another minute. She keeps plating cookies... until she realizes Neil’s go

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Neil? She turns. We hear the car start before we see it. Neil pulling away and driving off. Off Janet -- INT. ED WHITE’S CAR (MOVING) - LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Janet. In the backseat. Upset and embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I hate to be a bother.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: It’s no bother. Ed drives. Pat beside him. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Has he ever talked to you about her? About Karen?  Janet stares 56.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: No. Not really.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I talk about her. But never to him. out the window. Off Ed, processing, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil stands under the stars, taking readings with the sex Practicing. Ed walks up. Neil glances Jotting notes down in a logbook beside him.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Hey. Neil just keeps taking readings. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Lovell said Buzz was mouthing off. Certainly wasn’t the place for it. over. Something not sitting well.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You know Deke had doubts about Elliot. Deke moved him off Eight.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Deke wanted him for command.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Neil. Elliot always flew too slow. (then) I mean, it’s tough to blame a guy for his own death. And Aldrin’s an asshole. But you of all people know--

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: (hot) No. I don’t. I didn’t investigate the crash, I didn’t study the flight trajectory, I wouldn’t pretend to know what happened. Ed's surprised. Neil’s DARK, more emotional than we’ve se

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: You all want to make yourselves feel better, but this had, it had nothing to do with Elliot. You know the odds, this... it happens, it’1l happen again and if you can’t handle it... you should do something else.  57. Neil contains himself, turns away. Starts taking readings

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Neil. Hey, we’re all broken up here, I didn’t mean to -- NEIL I need to practice.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We're going to be the first to dock, I need to practice.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Shit. You should be with your wife, playing with your kids --

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: And you should be minding your own damn business. He’s COLD. Ed reacts. Then walks off. As he goes, we see. Janet. In the window, a tired look in her eyes. She watch as Neil takes another reading. He seems unmoved. Exhauste Janet turns away, and we RACK FOCUS back to... Neil. SHAKING. As RATTLED as we’ve seen. He lowers the sextant... and stares down at the small label. “E. SEE.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil walks up the stairs. He turns off the light and star to head into the bedroom... when he HESITATES. He walks to the door across the hall, looks in at Rick an Mark in their beds, sleeping soundly. As he stands there, PUSH IN on his eyes. Filled with TEARS.

dialogues.speaker: INI. MASTER BEDROOM, ARMSTRONG HOUSE
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a familiar Westclox electric alarm clock. The ti flips to 6:00 AM and the alarm TRILLS. Janet stirs, rolls over. The bed is EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet, groggy, walks in, then STOPS. SURPRISED to see... Neil, with Rick and Mark at the kitchen table, huddled ov PAPER EARTH... pushing a PAPER GEMINI towards a PAPER AGE  58.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Before we can dock, we have to meet up with the Agena in space.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (telling Mark) That’s called rendezvous. Neil nods. Then notices Janet in the door. Watching them.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Hey. Janet, AFFECTED, swallows her emotions and starts breakfa PRELAP the sound of a THUNDERING ROCKET and SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UPSIDE DOWN through a cockpit window we see a rocket RUMB SKYWARD. As the cabin SHAKES...

dialogues.speaker: KSC CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Atlas-Agena Liftoff 10:00:30, flight dynamics plot looks very good. REVERSE TO Neil and Dave suited up, prepping for launch a getting strapped in by backups Pete Conrad and Richard Go Gemini VIII, Pre-Launch March 16, 1966, 10:00:30

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: You guys have a liftoff time for us?

dialogues.speaker: KSC CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Fido’s running numbers... PETE CONRAD (INTO COMMS) Hold still, wouldja? Neil looks over, sees Pete is STRUGGLING to buckle Dave’s parachute harness; one of its catches is clogged.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GORDON PETE CONRAD
dialogues.text: What is that? Glue? (calls outside) Guenter, you got a Swiss Army Knife?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: A Swiss Army Knife? Are you shitting me? Pad leader GUENTER WENDT (42, spectacles, bow tie) leans  59.

dialogues.speaker: GUENTER WENDT
dialogues.text: See if this’1l do the trick, Pete. He holds out a TOOTHPICK. Dave watches Pete dig in, AGITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Janet. Staring into a HALL MIRROR. Sweating.

dialogues.speaker: KSC CAPCOM, (0.C., COMMS)
dialogues.text: What’s going on up there? Do NEIL (0.C., COMMS) we need to hold? Neil? No, just a little glitch with Dave’s parachute. Janet reacts. A beat, then she wipes her eyes, STEELS her with a last look and walks into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LURTON SCOTT hovers by a NASA SQUAWKBOX, the kids in the

dialogues.speaker: LURTON
dialogues.text: Did you hear that? A glitch with his parachute?

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Neil doesn’t have much faith in the ejection seats anyway. Hardly reassuring. Lurton tries to keep it together as LI MAGAZINE PHOTOGRAPHER RALPH MORSE approaches with a camer

dialogues.speaker: RALPH MORSE
dialogues.text: Ladies, would you mind posing? It's the last thing they want to do, but it’s part of the They nod and pose, forcing smiles. As Morse takes photos

dialogues.speaker: RALPH MORSE FIDO, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Big day, big smiles. The Agena is looking good, orbit is 162 by 156.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The capsule is now SEALED and CLAUSTROPHOBIC. We’re CONFI with Neil and Dave, the tiny window providing little reli

dialogues.speaker: FIDO, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: T minus 2 minutes. KSC CAPCOM (COMMS) Engines to start, Neil.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Engines to start position, initiating LOX pressurization.  60.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Ground power removal... Pressurization initiated. Ground power removed.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Closing Visors, heaters off. KSC LAUNCH DIRECTOR (COMMS) Final pre-flight. They slide their visors closed. Dave eyes the clock, TENS And no, we’re not cutting away. We’re gonna HOLD ON NEIL DAVE STRAIGHT THROUGH THE LAUNCH IN REAL TIME...

dialogues.speaker: KSC LAUNCH DIRECTOR, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Booster? BOOSTER ENGINEER (COMMS) Go.

dialogues.speaker: FIDO
dialogues.text: I’m go.

dialogues.speaker: KSC LAUNCH DIRECTOR, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Doc? ...Doc? FLIGHT SURGEON (COMMS) Armstrong’s at 146 bpm.

dialogues.speaker: KSC LAUNCH DIRECTOR, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Commander? NEIL (INTO COMMS) I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: KSC LAUNCH DIRECTOR, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Do we need to hold, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: FIDO, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Colonel, even a 30 second hold will jeopardize our KSC LAUNCH DIRECTOR (COMMS) ability to rendezvous -- I understand. Doc? Dave glances at Neil. Is it nerves? PUSH IN on Neil’s eye

dialogues.speaker: KSC LAUNCH DIRECTOR, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Doc, I need an answer... FLIGHT SURGEON (COMMS) He’s within tolerable limits.

dialogues.speaker: KSC LAUNCH DIRECTOR, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: That’s a go... start APUs, FIDO (COMMS) start Gimbal... T minus 30 seconds. RELIEVED, Neil and Dave spring back into action...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Starting APUs. DAVE (INTO COMMS) Starting Gimbal.  61.

dialogues.speaker: KSC LAUNCH DIRECTOR, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Prepare for launch. DAVE (INTO COMMS) Roger. Stowing checklist. Dave stows the checklist, then he and Neil SET for launch we feel the weight of the last few minutes, months, years

dialogues.speaker: FIDO, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: 15 seconds... 10,9, 8, 7, 6... Main engines start... A DULL THUNDER from ten stories below...

dialogues.speaker: FIDO, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: 4, 3, 2, 1... Ignition... +..turns to a ROAR. Neil and Dave feel a JOLT as the anch bolts SHEAR OFF and the Titan JERKS them off the launch p

dialogues.speaker: KSC CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Lift-off! Lift-off 16:41:00! The THRUST kicks in, 7G’s SHOVING them into their seats. STRAINS, reaching forward to punch in roll and pitch prog

dialogues.speaker: KSC LAUNCH DIRECTOR, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Watch your clock, Gemini. NEIL (INTO COMMS) Got a Roll Program in. The roll is on. We have a Pitch program... Oddly, it’s CALMER then we’d imagine, the blue sky out th window easily sliding to black... but the STRAIN on Neil’ face tells us we’re accelerating to 18,000 MILES PER HOUR

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: DCS looks good, pulse is DAVE (INTO COMMS) good... Stage 2 tanks look good.

dialogues.speaker: KSC CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Go from the ground for staging.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: (entering staging command) Roger, we have staging ignit -- A SHEET OF FIRE washes over the craft... 100,000 POUNDS O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT'S FUCKING TERRIFYING. Dave FLINCHES... even Neil BLINK We wonder what the hell is going on and SMASH TO --  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From afar, it looks like the rocket is EXPLODING...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: We’re having Wally’s fireball DAVE SCOTT (COMMS) here. ---uh, yeah. We see the first stage fall away. The second stage LIGHTS then ROCKETS forward and we realize... Jesus, this is nor

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Fuel cells are solid, the second stage is a real good machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave REELS as Neil calmly refocuses on the gauges. A beat

dialogues.speaker: KSC CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Gemini 8, you’re go from the ground. Mark. V/VR = point zero eight.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Okay. Mode 3. (following Neil’s lead) Burn stop. Neil flicks off the engines and the men are JOLTED FORWAR tossed into MICROGRAVITY. Dave lets out a GRUNT... asa mission checklists FLOATS across the cabin. Engines off, it’s eerily QUIET. Dave takes a breath, glan out the window. The world’s UPSIDE DOWN, sky at his feet, horizon ABOVE his head. STRUCK, he nudges Neil... Neil looks up. It’s the view from the X-15, but FOUR TIME HIGHER. PUSH IN on Neil’s eyes, a surprising SENSE OF WON

dialogues.speaker: JIM LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: I alpha time is 15:06, orbit is 87 by 147, hold for plane adjust...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a hand PINNING a PAPER GEMINI onto a RUDIMENTARY ORBITAL MAP. A PAPER AGENA is already tacked on the map.

dialogues.speaker: PUBLIC AFFAIRS OFFICER, (ON LOUDSPEAKER)
dialogues.text: This is mission control, Houston, we will now begin rendezvous maneuvers.  63. The room is BUZZING. Kraft and Flight Director JOHN HODGE 37, British, gray, stand over a gaggle of MPAD ENGINEERS.

dialogues.speaker: HODGE
dialogues.text: I need the transfer arc, gentlemen. CLOSE ON a DIAGRAM of the two ships in orbit... SLIDE RUL CALCULATORS... PENCILS doing complex math... One of the engineers QUICKLY SCRIBBLES on a transparency RUNS it through a door under the BIG SCREEN up front, int THE PROJECTION ROOM. A DOZEN VU-GRAPHS behind the screens Clearly another era. Our engineer throws the slide up on Graph; it's BOUNCED off a mirror and -- IN MISSION CONTROL the hand drawn transparency APPEARS on big screen. Hodge nods to Jim Lovell at the CapCom Consol

dialogues.speaker: JIM LOVELL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Gemini 8, Houston CapCom. I DAVE (COMMS) have a Plane-Adjust update. ...uh, stand by, Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helmets, checklists, and mission rule books FLOAT about t cabin. Neil and Dave, helmets off, look OVERWHELMED.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: Where'd the flight book go? Dave turns to look, accidentally CLOCKS Neil in the head.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Shit, sorry. Let me know when you’re ready, 8. Neil spots the book, hands it to Dave.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Houston, Gemini 8, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: GET B: 02:45:50; 26.2 burn (writing it down) time, yaw 90 right, pitch O. Roger. Prepping for burn. CLOSE ON hands setting the YAW DIAL to 90 right; PITCH at THRUSTERS on. Neil’s eyes TICK to the clock. 2:45:28, 29.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Give me the call. DAVE SCOTT 10... 5, 4, 3, 2, 1, Now!  64. Neil hits the thrusters. POP POP POP!! The craft RUSHES T THE RIGHT. The mission plan SMACKS against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: Time check. ...Dave? (disoriented) 20 seconds... 25... 30, 31, 32, 33, 34... cut off. Neil lets go of the thrusters. It's QUIET; the mission pl FLOATS off the wall. Neil’s eyes TICK over the instrument

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I think we overdid it a little. He GRABS a calculator. As he works the numbers, SMASH TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hodge and Kraft stand over two MPAD engineers working num

dialogues.speaker: HODGE
dialogues.text: Shit. They went long. Jim, we're sending another burn.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: 8, sending a correction. That’s the wrong vector! The engineers are clearly at odds. Kraft steps in.

dialogues.speaker: KRAFT
dialogues.text: I need an answer, let’s go. One engineer takes charge, writes up a transparency, DASH into the projection room... and it APPEARS on the big scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil writes, but the pen SLIPS OUT of his hand and FLOATS

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Uh, Houston. Can you repeat that?

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Roger, Delta-V 2 feet per (grabs the pen, writes) second, 2 plus 0, posigrade. Okay, I’ve got it.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: 25 seconds, I’1l count you down.  65. Neil and Dave RUSH to set the burn; we go CLOSE ON the di YAW to 0; PITCH to 0; ROLL to 0. THRUSTERS on.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: 10 seconds. 5, 4, 3, 2, 1, burn it! Neil quickly gets into position and squeezes the thruster CRACK CRACK!! The craft LURCHES again, now to the left.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Off burn. What are your (letting go, to Dave) residuals? Position. Dave looks into the sextant.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: Sirius minus 12, Antares plus 4. Neil grabs a slide rule, does the math. Dave, TENSE, look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we have a visual on the Agena by now? Neil ignores him, keeps doing the math as we CUT TO--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet, TENSE, by the squawkbox. She glances over at the k pushing Neil’s PAPER GEMINI towards the PAPER AGENA...

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (ON SQUAWKBOX)
dialogues.text: 8, Houston. Do you read? No answer; it’s unnerving. Janet fidgets... then hears th door. She turns to find Ed and Pat. With another casserol

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: I couldn’t eat when Ed was up there, but I figured we could at least put on a show for the folks at Life. She makes a face at Morse. Janet laughs, then looks to Ed

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: It’s kind of you to come. I’m sure Neil would appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: No. But I’m glad you’re here.  A nice thaw... until Mr. Morse snaps a PHOTO.
Pat turns. Dear Lord, can we not get even a semblance of privacy? Ed glances out the window at the ARMY OF PRESS on the law

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I’m guessing the Cosmonauts have it easier on this front.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (ON SQUAWKBOX)
dialogues.text: 8, do you have visual on the Agena? 8, do you read? As they turn back to the squawk box, SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and Dave stare at calculators; something’s not right

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: You want me to... I get a horrendous 25 feet per --

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I can’t talk to you, I’ve got to figure this. Dave QUIETS as Neil works the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: 8, can you give us a status?

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Copy. Dave quickly adjusts the dials.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: ---3, 2, 1, burn. Neil HITS the thrusters. Neil lets go.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: Did you burn at 26:10?

dialogues.speaker: POP, POP
dialogues.text: Dave eyes the instruments,

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: No, I’ve got too much to do.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: (beat) ...okay. 25 forward, 8 left, 3 up. On my mark. Neil eyes TICK to the clock. The craft SWINGS left and jots down residuals.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: That - that’s right. It was about 30, negative 34... ..-but Neil goes quiet as he spots what looks like a BRIG STAR in the window.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Could be Sirius. Dave follows his gaze.  67.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: Could be. But Dave grabs a sextant, takes a reading... and SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Gemini 8, this is Houston DAVE SCOTT (INTO COMMS) Capcom. Do you read? Gemini 8 to Houston, we’ve got a visual on the Agena. ..-just as he says it, the Agena SWINGS out of the window

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: Ah, shit... NEIL I need a readout.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: 4 forward, 2 left... wait, needles are wandering. 12 forward, 1 right? The instruments OSCILLATE, two DIFFERENT headings. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We’ll burn the closed loop, 12 and 1. Ready? 3, 2, 1... burn. Neil HITS the thrusters again. POP POP... the Gemini give chase... and the Agena SWINGS into the window.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: There! We're swinging into... shit! Dave SQUINTS, BLINDED by the sun, appearing over the hori He shields his eyes, turns up the instrument panel lights

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I need range and rate. DAVE SCOTT 6,000 feet, 31 feet per second, going too fast! Neil SQUINTS at the Agena growing in the window... and HI the braking thrusters. POP! POP! POP! Steam SHOOTS OUT in front of us, slowing the Gemini...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: 19 feet per second... 3,400 feet... 2,880 feet, you need to slow down! THE AGENA SWINGS UP OUT OF THE WINDOW AGAIN! Fuck! Neil h the braking thrusters again, FIGHTING to slow down...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: 10 feet per second. 1,900 NEIL feet... Put in a little to the left.  68. Dave adjusts the dial. The Agena SWINGS in the window, LI LIKE A CHRISTMAS TREE IN THE DAYLIGHT. HOVERING in full v

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: God, that’s amazing! Outstanding job, Coach. Look at that sucker! Neil looks up. Again a touch of that CHILDLIKE WONDER.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Gemini 8, Houston Cap Com. Standing by for any Rendezvous remarks. Over.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: You tell them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of tight faces. Tense. Waiting for...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Houston, we’re station keeping on the Agena at about 150 feet. A few scattered CHEERS go up. Hodge, standing at his cons wipes his brow as Deke walks over.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: You okay, John? HODGE I’m... yes. I’m fine. But he looks TENSE, nervous for this last step as we CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON the Gemini, 150 feet from the Agena. We’re FAR AW the floating crafts DWARFED by the earth below. It’s SILE until... STEAM SHOOTS from the Gemini thrusters. As the Gemini slowly circles the Agena, we CUT INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil flies the Gemini, a LIGHTNESS to him. The grit of training, the darkness of Elliot's death all FALL AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Man it flies easy. This station keeping, there’s nothing to it. Dave SMILES at Neil's atypical enthusiasm as he moves the Gemini ever closer to the Agena...  69.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Houston, this is 8. We’re LOVELL (COMMS) sitting about 2 feet out. Okay. Stand by for a minute. HOLD ON Neil and Dave, waiting on the precipice.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Gemini 8, we have T/M solid. Go ahead and dock. Neil nods to Dave, who hits a switch. We hear a BUZZ, see CONE EXTEND through the docking window.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Extending docking cone. LOVELL (COMMS) 8, we’re showing cone rigid. Neil squeezes the throttle GENTLY, moving forward slowly. until the Gemini and the Agena CRUNCH together. It's JARR

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Okay, we’re going to cycle LOVELL (COMMS) our Right/Stop switch now. Roger. Neil nods to Dave. Moment of truth. Dave hits a switch. W hear the motor aboard the Agena WHIR and we PUSH OUTSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From afar, we see the Agena CLASP onto the Gemini, which mechanically PULLS IT IN... There’s a loud CLANK as it stops and we SMASH BACK INTO -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the cockpit, the Agena docking button LIGHTS UP, displ a green “RIGID” confirmation. Neil and Dave share a LOOK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole room waits. Hodge, Kraft, Deke on pins and need

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Flight, we are docked. Deke SMILES BROADLY as the room explodes with CHEERS. Kra shakes Hodge’s hand. Deke calls out...

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Someone call Cronkite, have him tell the Soviets they can go screw! And call Congress while you’re at it!  70. More CHEERS, laughter as the comms BUZZ. Neil, methodical

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Okay. Just for your information, the Agena was very stable, we are having no noticeable oscillations at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLASHBULB pops. Morse takes a photo of Janet and Rick, paper Gemini and Agena now GLUED TOGETHER over earth.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH MORSE
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Mrs. Armstrong. A great day for the United States. Ed walks up with a PLATE OF FOOD for Janet. She hesitates

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You can’t fast the whole three days. A beat. Then, as she takes the plate...

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (ON SQUAWKBOX)
dialogues.text: We’re about to have LOS, but I have some dope for you to follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave grabs a pen, takes notes as Lovell continues.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: CSQ will pick you up on the other.. But the Comms turn STATIC as they lose signal. Dave drops pen, sees Neil’s pulled out two PACKETS. DAY 1, MEAL B.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: No thanks, I want to prep the E.V.A.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We should eat. It’s an order. Neil holds a packet up to a nozzle on the console, injects it with water. It looks pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I think there’s some air bubbles. Neil tosses it to Dave, who spins it around, then leaves

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: I’m gonna let it breathe.  71. Dave grabs the EVA manual, glances at the console... PAUS

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: ..-Neil, we’re in a bank. Neil turns. CLOSE ON the 8 ball, showing a 30 degree roll

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: None of our thrusters are on, NEIL it must be the -- Cut the Agena’s thrusters. Dave quickly follows orders. Neil WATCHES the 8 ball...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Stabilizing... Reactivating OAMS, reorienting to correct position. Neil hits the Gemini's thrusters, but the ship LURCHES, s SPINNING. Dave GRUNTS. Neil’s eyes TICK to the console.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s shut everything down. They shut everything off, but the ship KEEPS SPINNING ON AXIS. Food, checklists, charts start FLYING about the CAB

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I need a thruster readout. DAVE SCOTT We're quiet but I read the Agena firing. PUSH IN on Neil, working the problem, eyes TICKING... .--.to the 8 BALL showing a HUGE BANK... ...to the GAUGES showing VIOLENT SPIN RATES... ...to DAVE STRUGGLING with the disparate G forces...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Prepare to separate from the Agena. Dave looks at Neil, UNSURE.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT NEIL
dialogues.text: I can’t map the trajectories, (cuts him off) we could smash into -- Reset the Agena to allow remote command. Dave follows orders. Neil GRABS the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: On my mark. 3, 2, 1, Disengage.  72. Dave FLIPS a switch; THE GREEN DOCKING LIGHT BLINKS OUT. FIRES the thrusters and the Gemini JERKS away... The Agena SPINS VIOLENTLY outside the window, Dave BLANCH as it NARROWLY MISSES the nose of the Gemini...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Engaging thrusters to reduce roll. Neil hits the throttle... but the ship SPINS FASTER, whip everything WILDLY around the cabin! Neil, SURPRISED, lets of the throttle, eyes TICKING to the console when... THWACK! A flight plan SMACKS him in the head!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: OAMS propellent down to 30 percent! Neil, it’s us! Neil STRAINS against the ROCKETING G FORCES, NAUSEATING a DEADLY... his eyes TICKING to the roll rate gauge at 300°

dialogues.speaker: FUCCI, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Gemini 8, CSQ. How do you read?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALM SEAS through the window. A few men helm the U.S.A.F. as JIM FUCCI, 42, mans a state of the art TRACKING CONSOL

dialogues.speaker: FUCCI, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Gemini 8, CSQ. How do you -- DAVE SCOTT (COMMS) We have serious problems! Fucci FREEZES, stares at his instrument panel.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: We’re tumbling end over end up here, we’re disengaged from the Agena. Off Fucci, PALE, SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kraft, Deke, Hodge gather round Lovell, listening intentl

dialogues.speaker: FUCCI, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: .---uh, what seems to be the (beat) problem? --rolling.. can’t turn off...  73.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: csQ, Flight. Did he say he FUCCI (COMMS) could not turn the Agena off? No, he’s separated from the Agena and is in a pretty violent tumble. Off the men, REACTING, we SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet, WHITE, kneels by the squawk box, leaning in to hea Morse SNAPS a photo. Ed shoots him a look and he slinks b

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT, (ON SQUAWKBOX)
dialogues.text: We have... left roll... we can’t... The box CUTS OUT. No static, just SILENT. Janet turns to Ed... who’s GRIM. Off Janet, TERRIFIED, SMASH BACK TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The capsule hurtles at A REVOLUTION A SECOND, the Agena spinning slowly in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: FUCCI, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Did you copy that, Flight? Sunlight FLASHES off the windows, SMASHING US BACK INTO -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight BLAZES intermittently, a STROBE LIGHT on the eph flying across the cabin. It’s DIZZYING...

dialogues.speaker: FUCCI, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: They seem to have a stuck thruster. Dave's eyes ROLL BACK. Neil clocks it, tries to focus on console, searching for an_ answer. The sound FADES to the SLOSHING in Neil’s ears as we SMASH INTO -- NEIL'S POV. He’s starting to GRAY OUT. He SHUTS his eyes OPENS them... everything SPINS AROUND HIM at nauseating s it’s almost as if he’s not moving at all... Now the sloshing in his ears FADES to EERIE QUIET... and hear THE AWFUL WHIR of KAREN'S COBALT MACHINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil SHUTS HIS EYES again... trying to PUSH the sound awa in the dark, he faintly HEARS a HISSING...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: OAMS thruster must be stuck...  74. Neil’s eyes FLY OPEN and he YANKS the breakers, CUTTING A POWER. It goes BLACK, save for the flickering sunlight... Neil’s eyes TICK over GAUGES. OAMS DROP but ROLL RATE kee RISING. PUSH IN ON Neil’s eyes, TWITCHING and SMASH INTO NEIL'S POV. A BLUR. The fuzzy roll rate needle inches pas 500°/second. Neil’s eyes start to roll back and... IT GOES DARK... Karen’s cobalt machine grows LOUDER... Neil FORCES his eyes open... they DART across the control searching for an answer, a way out... ..-when he looks overhead and spots a RED CONTROL.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Initiate RCS squibs. Dave. Dave! Neil shakes Dave, pulling him awake.

dialogues.speaker: FUCCI, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Gemini 8, CSQ, come in... We need a rocket to stop the spin. The Re-entry rockets... Dave, GROGGY, gets it. He reaches for the squibs.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: On my mark! 3, 2, 1, now! Dave blows the squibs and Neil REACHES OVER HIS HEAD, fli on the re-entry control system. NOTHING HAPPENS. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Didn’t fire. Re-Arm. Dave! Dave, struggling to stay conscious, resets.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: On my mark... 3, 2, 1, now. Dave re-arms as Neil again reaches up and... BOOM, BOOM, The re-entry boosters FIRE, SPINNING the capsule FASTER.. Neil GRIPS the thruster, BATTLES to stabilize the ship as FADES. Neil’s eyes TICK to the roll rate. 525, 530, 530.. the needle HOLDS. Is it working? PUSH IN ON Neil, FORCING HIMSELF to stay conscious, WILLING the needle to FALL...

dialogues.speaker: FUCCI, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Gemini 8, CSQ, come in. Gemini 8? As Neil, struggling, STARTS TO FADE, we SMASH TO --  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a needle, QUIVERING at 530°/second. Men crowd ar Fucci, staring. And sweating.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: CcSQ, is there a status update?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men stand frozen, worried. It’s SILENT. Lovell looks Kraft, Deke and Hodge. Conrad and others crowd round. GRI

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: csQ, this is Flight. Can you -- STATIC cuts him off. Then, faintly...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: .-.-regaining control... RCS CONRAD direct. Motherfucker. As the group lets out a collective breath, SMASH BACK TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, foggy, unsettled, watches Neil calmly pulsing the R eyes on the DROPPING roll rate gauge... 300°... 250°... 2

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Keep an eye on our RCS fuel. Dave nods, eyes the fuel gauge. The sun stops strobing, t flight plans stop whipping about the cabin...

dialogues.speaker: FUCCI, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: 8, CSQ. How are you doing? DAVE (INTO COMMS) We are pulsing the RCS pretty slowly so we don’t-- it’s all roll right, we are trying to kill our roll rate.

dialogues.speaker: FUCCI, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Okay. Everything’s okay. (to Neil) You believe this guy?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Move us back to one ring. Off Neil, CUT BACK TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hodge leans in.  76.

dialogues.speaker: HODGE, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: csQ, Flight. Find out how FUCCI (COMMS) much RCS fuel he has used. Roger. Gemini 8, CSQ. How much RCS have you used?

dialogues.speaker: KRAFT
dialogues.text: (to the MPAD guys) I want emergency landing options. Hodge and Deke both turn to Kraft, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: What about the E.V.A. and -- KRAFT We gotta get them home. Kraft heads off. As Deke REELS, Ed walks up. Sotto --

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Jan's outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Jan waiting by the door. In her eyes, intense AN and WORRY. A long beat... then Deke walks out with Ed.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Neil’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: The ship’s stable, he'll be all right, Jan. I need you to go home.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: (processes, then) Fine. Turn the box back on.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: I’‘ll see what I can -- JANET Turn it back on now.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: There’s a security protocol, JANET I can’t just -- Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Jan. You have to trust me, we have this under control.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: All these goddamn protocols and procedures to make it seem like... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JANET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: like it’s ‘under control.’ You're a bunch of boys making models from balsa wood, you don’t have anything under control. TEARS WELL... Embarrassed and ANGRY, she STALKS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Take her home, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What do we say to the press? Deke doesn’t follow.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: The Life guy, Morse, he was PAO (0.C.) with Jan, he leaked it to -- Deke, I need a statement. The Public Affairs Officer RUNS up.

dialogues.speaker: PUBLIC AFFAIRS OFFICER
dialogues.text: We're getting calls from the networks, the papers, local news... Shit. Off Deke, CUT BACK TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet, a checklist floating calmly, the roll stopped

dialogues.speaker: FUCCI, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: 8, Flight’s told me to relay that they're looking into 6 or 7 dash 3 area at this time. Please enter re- entry Module 4 in the ATM computer. Dave hesitates, realizing they're terminating the flight. Neil just pulls out a map, surveys the landing area.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Right in the middle. Okinawa. That was the third choice, remote areas. (then) I'd like to argue. About the going home. But I don’t know how we can. The slightest hint of frustration. But there’s nothing to

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: I’1ll get started on re-entry. Downcast, Dave turns to the basic computer, starts punchi numbers in when... POP! POP! POP! Dave STIFFENS, SPINS...  78. +..to find Neil FIRING the OAMS thrusters.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: What are-- we'll start to spin again!

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Only way to find the culprit. Off Dave, UNNERVED, CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room BUZZES, prepping for re-entry. Gilruth huddles w Deke and Kraft. A beat. Then we hear Lovell --

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (0.C., INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: 8, we're showing your roll rate back up to 90 degrees. Confirm? Neil? The men turn, ALARMED. Hodge and Lovell look TENSE.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL NEIL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Neil? (beat ) Checking OAMS, thruster 8 failed open at present.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: This could have been true at the time of the incident, although we cannot verify that at this time. Is he nuts? Hodge leans into the Comms.

dialogues.speaker: HODGE, (OVER COMMS)
dialogues.text: Neil, this is Hodge, we’ve got ten minutes to re-entry, let’s put a pin in the analysis for now, shall we? Off the men, we CUT TO -- INT. ED’S CORVETTE - NIGHT Ed drives Janet home. She stares ahead, STILL FURIOUS. Ed considers talking, thinks better of it. A beat, then he t onto their street. We see the HORDE of PRESS. It’s GROWN.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS PRESS, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: Mrs. Armstrong? Janet? Can we get a photo? Jan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed PUSHES into the house with Janet, press calling out af them until Ed SHUTS THE DOOR. The press falls back.  79. As Jan recovers, Ed glances at Pat, on the sofa with the kids... watching Adam West’s BATMAN. OBLIVIOUS. Ed smiles when the show is INTERRUPTED by an ABC NEWS SPECIAL REPOR

dialogues.speaker: PETER JENNINGS, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: We’ve interrupted our regular program due to the emergency RICK return of Gemini 8... Mom? SCARED, Rick looks to Janet. At a loss, she walks into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet pours herself a glass of water. She starts to lift but her hand is SHAKING. Janet tries to settle herself... ...-but she can’t. The glass shakes even MORE VIOLENTLY, Janet has no choice but to set it down. As Janet leans against the sink, STRUGGLING, we PRELAP--

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (COMMS, PRELAP)
dialogues.text: One minute to LOS. Naha RESCUE 1 will be on station at splashdown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave stows gear while Neil checks headings, helmets now o

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: ...I have a backup yaw star for you at Retrofire minus 4 minutes. Sirius will be 4 degrees. Stand by for -- The COMMS CUT OUT. They're on their own.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: 30 seconds. I’m on Auto NEIL (INTO COMMS) Retro -- I‘1l do it manually. Dave looks UNSURE, but Neil reaches for the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Retro Rocket Squibs - Arm. (flicks the 4 squibs) 1, 2, 3, 4, LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Okay. Count me down. (eyes on the clock) ...5, 4, 3, 2, 1 RETROFIRE. Neil FIRES the Retro-rockets... he and Dave are SLAMMED i their seats as the spaceship HURTLES down towards the ear  80.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Props off. Retro-power, safe. Retro- jett, safe. Lock restraint harness. Neil’s harness won't lock. Frustrated, he JAMS the buckle together... RESTRICTING his right arm. Neil grimaces as sunlight streams in, the horizon at the top of the window

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: I keep thinking there’s something we've forgotten about... Neil’s uncharacteristically ANTSY. It makes Dave NERVOUS.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: We did everything, far as I know. If not, it’s too late. The atmosphere GRABS HOLD, G forces INCREASING. The heat CONSUMES them, the plasma GLOWING PINK in the window... As Neil and Dave SWEAT and STRAIN against it all, we -- SMASH TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: GILRUTH, (0.C., OVER BLACK)
dialogues.text: Gemini 8 saw two complex vehicles launched on the same day, on time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gilruth stands at the podium, addressing a MASS of report Gemini 8 Pilot Press Conference March 26, 1966

dialogues.speaker: GILRUTH
dialogues.text: ...we saw a flawless rendezvous and docking. All of which has tended to be overshadowed by the malfunction. Find Neil behind him with Dave and NASA personnel. Neil l MORE UNCOMFORTABLE than he was moments ago...

dialogues.speaker: GILRUTH
dialogues.text: But I think we should focus on the progress resulting from the mission.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low, Gilruth, Kraft, Deke and ARMY BRASS at a long table. Neil and Dave sit across from them.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE LOW
dialogues.text: Neil, the board would like to focus on the malfunction. We hear CLACKING, spot a STENOGRAPHER. It’s a FORMAL MISS REVIEW. And judging by Low’s tone, Neil's job is on the l

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE LOW
dialogues.text: Can you walk us through the decision to separate from the Agena? As Neil considers, we SMASH BACK TO -- THE PRESS CONFERENCE. A HOUSTON POST reporter.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSTON POST REPORTER
dialogues.text: You mentioned the rate of revolution was more than once a second. How near were you to being unconscious?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We didn’t have any specific difficulty in observing the panel.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSTON POST REPORTER
dialogues.text: You hadn’t begun to gray out or anything like that? Off Neil, HESITATING, not in his element, SMASH BACK TO - THE FORMAL MISSION REVIEW.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE LOW
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you use the Agena to stabilize the combined craft?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We did. This was not effective. And, as I’ve said, we initially assumed there was some anomaly in the Agena control system.

dialogues.speaker: TIMES REPORTER, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: Okay, but have you really ruled out the possibility that you... THE PRESS CONFERENCE. A TIMES Reporter.  82.

dialogues.speaker: TIMES REPORTER
dialogues.text: ..-accidentally or intentionally activated some electrical system at the time this trouble occurred? Neil HESITATES... and questions KEEP COMING. In QUICK CUT

dialogues.speaker: AGENCE FRANCE REPORTER
dialogues.text: Did you have any feeling of anxiety after the failure of the thrusters?

dialogues.speaker: HAMBURG PRESS
dialogues.text: In the midst of the spinning did you seem to realize or feel the presence of God closer than other times?

dialogues.speaker: CHICAGO TRIBUNE
dialogues.text: Does this make you question whether the space program is worth the cost? In money and in lives?

dialogues.speaker: ABC REPORTER
dialogues.text: Neil, I have about 8,000 letters from Batman fans, which I wonder if you would like to answer? SPIN BACK TO Neil. Blank, EXHAUSTED. Is he going to EXPLO

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I appreciate your problem, why don't you see if you can rerun the Batman sequence for them? And for us. We missed it too. A pause. Then the room breaks into LAUGHTER. Neil forces smile as we SMASH BACK TO -- THE CONFERENCE ROOM. The men huddle. PULL BACK to find Ne still sitting there. Waiting. A LONG beat, then Low stand

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE LOW
dialogues.text: Thanks, Neil. There’s a lot to discuss but I think that’s all for now. We'll be in touch soon. It’s not warm. Neil stands but no one else does. As Neil awkwardly walks out, UNSURE OF HIS FUTURE, we PRELAP -- NEIL (PRELAP) (CONT’D) No, no, no! It’s unacc-- it’s unacceptable!  83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Neil on the phone. As AGITATED as we’ve seen him

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: It’s, it’s, it’s sensationalist. It’s not appropriate, it’s not an appropriate title for the piece! Neil holds an ADVANCED COPY of a LIFE MAGAZINE article: “ Wild Ride in Space!" by Neil Armstrong.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I’m not interested in how the other magazines are framing the story! Now we see the Wall Street Journal on the kitchen table. headline below the fold: Moon Race: Can’t Machines Do It?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Well then... then maybe my name shouldn't be on the damn article! Neil SLAMS down the phone. Janet, plating dinner, looks u

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Neil? But he walks out. Off Janet, CONCERNED, PRELAP a DOORBELL EXT. ED WHITE’S HOUSE - DAY Ed opens the front door. And finds Janet.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Can you come over?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Not sure that’s gonna help.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Please. She’s insistent. Ed hesitates but Pat, at the door as wel nudges him. He heads across the yard. Pat offers a smile.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: My sister married a dentist. I used to wonder what it was like. He’s home by six every night. And every three months my sister calls to say she wishes he weren’t. Janet manages a laugh. A beat.  84.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I keep hoping it’ll be better. If things go right. When they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LARGE DESK. Covered with SCHEMATICS of the Agena, DATA Gemini 8, DIAGRAMS of the Gemini’s sixteen OAMS thrusters FIND Neil hunched over it all with an ENGINEER'S PAD. HOL him, studying the malfunction, working the problem. We he a RUMBLE and Neil looks up... Ed rolls down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Back to work?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I’m trying to find a way to isolate a single thruster. It's AWKWARD, the fight still not really behind them. A b

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I was gonna go over to Dave's. No response from Neil. Ed, giving up, starts to retreat..

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: .--I could use a break. Ed pauses. He and Neil share a look. Detente. WE HEAR the Second Movement of Dvorak's New World Symphony and CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and Ed sit drinking with Dave Scott. They listen to TRACK, Dvorak washing over them. Off the music --

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Felt a little like that, right? Being up there?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: How much did you have to drink? Neil tosses a empty beer can at Ed. Ed laughs. So does Ne

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: I will say one thing. It’s all I can think about. Getting back up. Neil nods. Ed eyes his beer, an odd look on his face.  85. DAVE SCOTT (CONT’D) What?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Gus grabbed me earlier. He and Deke want me on the team.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: For the first Apollo mission? Ed nods, tentative. Dave explodes, thrilled for him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: Holy shit. That’s huge! NEIL (CONT'D) That Saturn’s a monster. It’s gonna be a helluva ride. Neil’s SMILING, genuinely excited.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: You know Deke wants Gus to be first one on the moon, so that first team--

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Let’s not get ahead of ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, but it is pretty exciting. Heck, just to be the first to test the new capsule --

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah, Gus is already bitching.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: I’1l bet.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Well, I can’t wait to hear about it.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Gus bitching? You will. They all laugh, Ed clearly relieved at Neil’s reaction. EXT. DAVE SCOTT’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Neil stumble out of Dave’s house, start walking ho They walk quietly for a beat. Then --

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Janet told me you came ‘round during the mission.  86.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You would have done the same.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: No. I wouldn’t have. Ed looks at Neil. Then LAUGHS. Neil does too. Then he slows, looking up at the night sky. Ed smiles.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: You ever fly an Aeronca?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Sure. Learned to fly on one.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I flew that plane a ton before I joined the Navy. I used to like coming down steep on final approach so I could land early and have time to roll out...

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Bet the Navy instructors loved that.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: They beat it out of me.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: After Korea, I went back to Purdue. The flight club had an Aeronca, so one weekend I flew it home to Wapakoneta. I put it into a big slip on final approach like when I was a kid... I banged the thing so hard on the landing, it couldn’t fly back.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You crashed an Aeronca? After all those missions in Korea?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Had to take the wings off and haul it back to Lafayette on a trailer.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I hope none of the coeds saw you. Ed smiles broadly. Neil smiles back... then he TIGHTENS.  87.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: The whole way back, I kept trying to replay the landing in my head. But I couldn't. I hadn’t been paying attention. It was like riding a bike so I'd just... I hadn’t been paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Neil.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I keep thinking if I'd been smarter, if I'd done a little more prep...

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I was distracted. After Elliot... I was distracted.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Neil. This wasn’t your fault. But Neil isn’t sure. Off the DOUBT in his eyes, CUT TO -- EXT. GILRUTH’S OFFICE, MANNED SPACE CENTER - NIGHT A long hallway. At the end of it, Neil sits on a folding chair outside the corner office. TAPPING his foot. CLOSE ON Neil, SWEATING. Nervous unlike anything we’ve se He scratches his leg. Again. Foot still TAPPING. At last, the door opens. Deke leans out.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Neil. Come on in. Neil stands. Quickly. Deke leads him into -- INT. GILRUTH’S OFFICE, MANNED SPACE CENTER - NIGHT Wood paneling, a few service plaques, function over form. Gilruth sits behind a desk, Kraft at a work table.

dialogues.speaker: GILRUTH
dialogues.text: Hey, Neil. Don’t bother sitting, it’s gonna be a short meeting. Neil stands. Awkward.  Neil doesn’t 88.

dialogues.speaker: GILRUTH
dialogues.text: We've talked it through and we think it’s pretty clear. If you hadn’t kept cool, well, you wouldn’t be here and we'd still be asking what the hell happened.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: So would Congress. It coulda been a showstopper.

dialogues.speaker: GILRUTH
dialogues.text: You docked, you got your ship home, this mission was a success. And we're gonna treat it that way from here on out. You good with that?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: ..-yes sir. show much, but he’s clearly relieved.

dialogues.speaker: GILRUTH
dialogues.text: I trust you won’t mind representing us next month at the White House?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Uh, no sir.

dialogues.speaker: GILRUTH
dialogues.text: Good. Then you're dismissed. Neil nods, walks out. Deke follows him into --

dialogues.speaker: MANNED SPACE CENTER
dialogues.text: Neil and Deke walk down the hall. A beat, then -- Deke glances

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: ...I don’t really have to go to the White House, do I? at him.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: I know you think this is bullshit, nobody likes kissing up to those idiots in D.C. But it’s part of the job. Especially nowadays. Off Neil, less than thrilled, CUT TO --  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet holds up a BLUE SUIT. Irritated.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Neil Alden Armstrong, you cannot wear a suit! Neil, in an APRON, makes pancakes. PERFECT HALF DOLLARS.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: It said Black Tie Optional.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: You’re one of three astronauts representing NASA, Deke specifically told me it was not optional. Neil frowns as Ed walks in the front door with a duffle.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Nice apron. Manly.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Would you tell him he’s got to wear a tuxedo to the White House?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I dunno, maybe he should wear the apron.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Don’t you have a plane to catch? Ed laughs. And notices SCHEMATICS on the table. DIAGRAMS the LUNAR LANDING TEST VEHICLE, an odd, free-flying train that’1l simulate lunar gravity. And yes, it’s an update o the diagram that inspired Neil to join Apollo back on P.1

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Is this the lunar landing Sim?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Gene and the folks at FRC have been having a heck of a time with it.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (off the diagrams, impressed) It’s completely fly by wire?  90.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Does a decent job simulating lunar gravity but if the electrical system craps out or you get a good 20 knot wind, it’s a real hairy deal. Deke asked me to take a look but I think the thing’s just too damn dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: This from the ‘Hero of Gemini 8’? Neil grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Don’t get him started again. He’s been grumbling about the trip all morning.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: How ‘bout we trade and I go to the Cape?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: No, you got the guts, you gotta go enjoy the glory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON an OPEN SUITCASE. Socks, underwear and A TUX; pa METICULOUSLY. Neil adds a dopp kit then hesitates. He pic it up. Eyes TICKING over the toothbrush, toothpaste...

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: You already repacked it. Twice. Neil looks up flustered, AGITATED. Janet moves to him.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: When you meet the President, just look at his shoes. It’1l be okay. Neil looks up, nods. Janet leans in, kisses his cheek, st to go... but he pulls her back.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I, uh, I know I, since I got back...

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: It’s okay. It isn’t really. But she wants to be strong for him. Neil VULNERABLE, pulls her in. Holds tight. Off Janet, CUT TO  gl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Neil. In a TUXEDO. Stiff. Uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: PETE CONRAD, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Looks like he was born in a tux. REVERSE to Conrad and Jim Lovell, across from Neil. Conra SMIRKS at Neil as the limo stops and the door opens on... A_RED CARPET. REPORTERS line the entrance to THE WHITE HO As Pete gets out, WAVING, we HOLD ON Neil... uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT JOHNSON, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: We have never succeeded in freeing our planet from war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a formal international document: The Treaty on O Space, January 27, 1967. As LBJ’s familiar voice rolls on ...REVEAL a room of DIGNITARIES. LBJ sits at a signing ta We're BEHIND HIM with Neil and the other astronauts.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT JOHNSON, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: But this treaty means the moon will serve only the purposes of peace... and that astronaut and cosmonaut might meet on the moon as brothers. LBJ hands a pen to a heavyset AMBASSADOR wearing a SICKLE As he moves to sign the treaty, Conrad whispers to the ot

dialogues.speaker: PETE CONRAD
dialogues.text: What a load of horseshit. Neil turns, but before Pete can go on, they’re overwhelme APPLAUSE and FLASHBULBS. As Neil flinches, we FLASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovell and Neil talk to a Senator. Neil clings to a beer.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL
dialogues.text: ...we’re very bullish on Apollo.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR
dialogues.text: I should hope, given the time we’ve spent developing it. Neil looks uncomfortable. The congressman notices.  92.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR
dialogues.text: Commander Armstrong? You disagree?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We learned to fly sixty years ago. So if you consider the technological development in the context of history --

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR
dialogues.text: I’m considering it in the context of taxpayer dollars. Neil doesn’t know what to say. Lovell steps in...

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL
dialogues.text: So are we, Senator. And between us, if the capsule passes plugs out, we'll have a heck of a launch next month. I’m sure Mr. Gilruth would be happy to discuss it in detail. Lovell leads the Senator across the room to Gilruth... an away from Neil. Neil awkwardly drifts toward the bar. He stands there for a moment, totally out of place... whe PRETTY STAFFER appears at his side with a FLIRTY SMILE.

dialogues.speaker: PRETTY FEMALE STAFFER
dialogues.text: Aren’t you someone I should know?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: ...uh, probably not. She walks off, confused.

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: We need to get you a stronger drink. Neil sees Conrad’s beside him. Conrad waves for a beer.

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: No stomach for political theater?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: ...that what this is?

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: We've got more troops on the ground in Vietnam every day. You think LBJ wants astronaut and cosmonaut to ‘meet on the moon as brothers’?  93.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Then why sign the treaty?

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: You can’t lose a race you don’t run. (off Neil) We’re still neck and neck with the Russians, and for what? ICBM’s have made space irrelevant, militarily. Why break the bank on the moon when you could spend it in Saigon?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: ..-you think he’d just drop Apollo?

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. If LBJ wasn’t from Texas we'd already be dead. Neil stares at him. Lovell walks

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: Jesus, Armstrong, where’ve you been? Did you see the polling on Apollo?

dialogues.speaker: ARMSTRONG
dialogues.text: No. I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: Well, it’s not good.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL
dialogues.text: Knock it off, Pete. up, nods to the bartender for a beer.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL
dialogues.text: We launch Apollo, nobody's going to cut our funding. That shiny new capsule’s gonna have every kid in the country dreaming about a trip to the moon.

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: That shiny new capsule hasn’t passed plugs out.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL
dialogues.text: Talk to me in an hour. He takes a drink, then leans into Neil so Pete can’t hear

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL
dialogues.text: Any word on plugs out?  94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deke rides up the elevator with Gus, Ed and ROGER CHAFFEE suited up, carrying helmets. Ed looks down the side of th SATURN 1B ROCKET, at the cape stretching out below. THRIL

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Pretty, isn’t she? Yes, we're 40 STORIES UP, scaling a rocket FOUR TIMES THE OF GEMINI’S TITAN and it’s SPECTACULAR. But only Ed notic

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I think the 21st is pushing it.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: The Russians have already tested the Soyuz. Once they get the Proton-K off the ground --

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I got it. But if the capsule’s not ready, it’s not ready. I’m not going up there in a lemon.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: No. We wouldn’t let you. The elevator stops. Short. A FOOT below ADJUSTABLE LEVEL and the GLEAMING APOLLO CAPSULE sitting atop the Saturn. Gus SHOOTS Deke a look, pulls himself up, we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAD LEADER GUENTER WENDT oversees techs removing thick po cords from the new APOLLO CAPSULE. It’s very shiny indeed

dialogues.speaker: GUENTER WENDT
dialogues.text: Power up the capsule’s internal batteries for plugs out. Closing hatches now. Through the hatch, we see Ed, helmet now on, pushes the i hatch towards us SEALING THE CAPSULE. We feel the excitem as techs close the middle hatch above it and we go... CLOSE ON RATCHETS. Tightening six different latches. CUT from RATCHET to RATCHET until...

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: Ablative hatch closed. Closing the boost protective cover. They close the cover, start the process again. PUSH INTO  95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON another ratchet tightening a latch.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: That’s all of ‘em. FIND Ed in the familiar Apollo cockpit. He glances at the OTHER FIVE LOCKED LATCHES, puts away the ratchet.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Ready for oxygen purge. We hear the HISS of oxygen... and SNIPPETS of conversatio over Comms. Gus, beside Ed, hits the comms button.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Guys, we’ve got an open mic. LAUNCH DIRECTOR (COMMS) Uh, let’s hold the countdown. A beat. The crew looks annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Sorry guys, we’ll get this squared.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: How are we gonna get to the moon if we can’t talk between two buildings? LAUNCH DIRECTOR (COMMS) .--Gus, we didn’t get that. As Gus, pissed, shakes his head, we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elevator DINGS. Lovell, Conrad and Neil get off.

dialogues.speaker: PETE CONRAD
dialogues.text: I’m gonna get outta this monkey suit and head to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL
dialogues.text: I’m in. Neil?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I think I’11 check in with the Cape.

dialogues.speaker: PETE CONRAD
dialogues.text: You hell raiser, you. Neil peels off.  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil walks in, neatly hangs his jacket in the closet. He pulls at his tie, sits on the bed and reaches for the pho DIALING then taking off his shoes as he waits for...

dialogues.speaker: PETRONE, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: Rocco.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: It’s Neil. How’s it going there?

dialogues.speaker: PETRONE, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: We're on a hold. Glitch in the Comms, about ten away, I think.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Huh. Okay. How’s the capsule look?

dialogues.speaker: PETRONE, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: Oh, she’s a beaut. Neil can’t help but smile. Excited for Apollo. For Ed.

dialogues.speaker: PETRONE
dialogues.text: Happy to give you guys a holler a bit later with a status report.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: That'd be great. Thanks, Rocco. Neil hangs up, grabs the remote... a Zenith ‘SPACE COMMAN He blinks at the name... then snaps on the TV and settles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed looks over a manual, clearly BORED.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: A few more minutes, we’ve just about got it sorted. GUS (INTO COMMS) Shit, we’re gonna be here all night. ED (INTO COMMS, to Roger) He’1l turn the corner. In half an hour he’1l be singing Sinatra. GUS (INTO COMMS, to Ed) Stop screwing around, wouldya?  97.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Easy, everyone just cool it. GUS (INTO COMMS) Get the damn comms working and we'll cool it.

dialogues.speaker: TECH, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: I got a surge in the AC Bus 2 LAUNCH DIRECTOR (COMMS) Voltage. Try resetting the meter. Gus, happy to have something to do, looks over the gauges

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Rog, you see anything on the dials? Chaffee turns to look and notices a SMALL FLAME on the fl Before he can react... the flame JUMPS.

dialogues.speaker: CHAFFEE, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Hey! The flame FLASHES through the cockpit, FIRE BLAZING aroun three of them. Ed and Gus react -- it’s frighting, but th stay CALM, HUSTLING through evacuation procedures... Ed reaches for the hatch... the latches are TIGHT. He gra ratchet, STRUGGLES to loosen a latch, but his arm is ENGU by fire. He KEEPS WORKING... even as his suit starts to M Ed GRIMACES. The latch isn’t budging. His eyes DART to th other five latches. As he starts to PANIC, SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FAR VIEW of the CAPSULE from 400 feet below. It looks f

dialogues.speaker: PETRONE, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Gus? Can you hear us up there? LAUNCH DIRECTOR ROCCO PETRONE, 40, eyes the capsule on th MONITOR. We’re in a makeshift LAUNCH COMMAND at the base the rocket. Deke walks up with a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Comms are still out?

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: Should have been fixed by now. The tech at the comms shrugs. Petrone tries again.

dialogues.speaker: PETRONE, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Gus, can you hear -- ED (COMMS) We got a fire in the cockpit!  98. Petrone pauses, eyes the monitor... as the hatch window L UP, turning WHITE. Deke remains calm.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Okay. Get them out of there.

dialogues.speaker: PETRONE, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Hey crew, can you egress at this time? Confirm it. No response. Deke takes the Comms.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Guenter, get in there and help them. Deke looks up. High above, techs move towards the capsule

dialogues.speaker: PETRONE, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Crew did we get verification? CHAFFEE (COMMS) Can you egress at -- We have a bad fire! We’re burning up! We’re burning... They hear Chaffee SCREAM. It’s PRIMAL, HEART-STOPPING. De now CONCERNED, looks up. A beat, then -- BOOM!!! The capsule RUPTURES, SMOKE POURING OUT... Everyone in the blockhouse PALES. Deke and Petrone stare, incredulous as the techs above fall back.

dialogues.speaker: PETRONE, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Pad leader, are you able to GUENTER WENDT (COMMS) hear them? Guenter -- All the smoke, we can’t... Deke, UNNERVED, takes the comms, tries to remain professi

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Gus, can you hear us? Gus? But there's NO RESPONSE. Off Deke --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet reads, Rick and Mark play on floor. A quiet moment. until the phone RINGS. Janet stands, picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JANET, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: Janet, it’s Deke. There’s been an accident at the Cape. We... we don’t know how bad yet. Would you mind going over to Pat’s?  99. Off Janet, PALE, SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids play as Janet helps Pat carry in grocery bags.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Thank goodness you swung by, I'd have a car full of melted ice pops. Pat smiles, chipper, when the doorbell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: You mind tossing the rest of the perishables into the fridge?

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Of course not. Pat exits. Janet puts the milk in the fridge... when she hears an AWFUL, GUT WRENCHING, ANIMALISTIC SCREAM. Jan freezes. As the sound RIPPLES through her, SMASH TO -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil as we left him, on his bed, tux still on, watching T And waiting. A beat. Then the phone RINGS. Neil grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: Neil.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hey. How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: (pause) Not great, there was... an accident. No easy way to say this... Ed, Gus and Roger, they’re, they’re gone. Neil sits there. Blinks. Not following.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. It was a test.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: We think there was a wiring issue.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I don’t... I don’t follow.  100.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: There was a fire and, and we'll get to the bottom of it. Right now we need you guys to lay low. The press is all over this, Senator Mondale’s going to call for an investigation, we don’t want you to have to deal with any of that, okay? Neil?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yes. Okay. Thanks. Neil hangs up. A beat. Neil sits, silent. Blank. He lifts the phone, as if to make a call... and holds the receiver dial tone PULSING, growing LOUDER, until... ..-he SMASHES the receiver on the cradle. Again. And again. And AGAIN. Harder now. Until he’s smashing the receiver on the cradl with such FORCE... ...that the phone CRACKS... the nightstand BUCKLES. And still he continues. Pain and rage pouring out... He keeps POUNDING the phone... UNTIL it’s PULVERIZED... U the nightstand SPLITS... UNTIL his fingers, his hand star BLEED... UNTIL at last he runs out of steam. And pauses. PANTING. His face contorted... his eyes TICKI to his hand. BADLY MAULED, blood DRIPPING down the phone. We hold on him for an awful beat and then we... FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON NEIL’S FACE. Eyes focused, but EMOTIONLESS. DEAD A stark contrast to the jagged hand-held camera. And a st contrast to the Neil we last saw. Wounds buried, yet ther the surface. Scar tissue, invisible to most, less so to u Ellington Air Force Base May 6, 1968  101.

dialogues.speaker: JIM LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Winds are pretty rough today, keep an eye on your translation rates. PULL BACK to find Neil exposed to the elements, strapped THE LUNAR LANDING TEST VEHICLE. A MESS of METAL PIPES wit COCKPIT. The realization of the DIAGRAMS we saw on P.101.

dialogues.speaker: JIM LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Approaching altitude, drifting east. NEIL (INTO COMMS) Copy. Correcting. Neil hits the thruster and a BURST of peroxide spits out our right. As it pushes the LLTV left we PULL BACK FURTHE Neil’s HUNDREDS OF FEET ABOVE THE GROUND in a contraption doesn’t look like it should fly. Jesus. The camera does a WILD 360 around the belching craft then... PUSHES IN on N

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Five hundred feet. Switching to lunar mode and starting descent. Dead-eyed, but alert, Neil hits a button and starts to gu the LLTV to a landing. Thrusters POP and HISS; the craft ROCKS and BUCKS, but Neil’s eyes REMAIN STEADY on his gau CLOSE ON the ALTITUDE GAUGE: 400... 300... 200 feet.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Final landing approach. Neil calmly pilots the LLTV down through 100 feet... When bottom FALLS OUT. The craft starts to DROP RAPIDLY. Neil PULLS on the thruster, but the LLTV doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: JIM LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Increase altitude! Neil! Neil HITS the thrusters again... The craft SHOOTS UP to 2 feet... then ROLLS SHARPLY TO THE RIGHT!! It’s terrifying

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Attitude control degrading. Steam SPITS from the thrusters; peroxide particles burn N neck. UNFAZED, he tries to correct the roll... only to ha the craft go UP_ON IT’S SIDE LIKE A CARNIVAL RIDE! Neil quickly PULLS the throttle right, but now the LLTV S

dialogues.speaker: JIM LOVELL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Your translation rates are too high! You’ve gotta bail out! Neil, do you hear me, you have to bail out now! But Neil, eyes DARK, barely registers this. Lovell’s voic FADES... then THE SOUND DROPS OUT ENTIRELY. PUSH IN TIGHT ON NEIL’S FACE IN TOTAL SILENCE. We clock the INTENSITY, HARD and COLD, the DARKNESS in hi eyes... MORE FRIGHTENING than anything happening around h A long beat... then Neil’s eyes TICK DOWN. We see the ground RUSHING UP to meet the craft.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: I gotta go. LIGHTENING FAST Neil PULLS the ejection handle. BOOM!!! SOUND COMES RUSHING BACK as the Ejection Seat EXPLODES ou the LLTV, TOSSING Neil a hundred feet up into the air!!! POP POP POP! Neil’s parachute unfurls, stabilizing us jus time to see the LLTV CRASH below... and BURST INTO FLAMES Off Neil, staring down at the FIERY BLAZE OF METAL, PRELA

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: The vehicle is not safe. EXT./INT. DEKE’S OFFICE, MSC, HOUSTON - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kraft and Deke argue with Neil.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: We need to shut it down, Neil.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: It’s the best simulation we have.

dialogues.speaker: KRAFT
dialogues.text: Yes, but --

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Landing in lunar gravity is the most substantial hurdle left; the vehicle gives us the best approximation of flight in a lunar environment.  103.

dialogues.speaker: KRAFT
dialogues.text: Okay, but you and the others are too valuable to risk on a fly by wire system with no backup.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: The ejection seat is the backup.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Neil, the political fallout NEIL from another accident -- That’s what you’re worried about?

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: You could have died, Neil. NEIL But I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: A split second more and -- NEIL We need to fail! Deke REACTS, but Neil’s too far gone to notice...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: That’s the point. These tests aren’t about getting it right, they’re about knowledge. We fail and we learn and we fail and we learn and it’s the only goddamn reason we've gotten this far. We have to keep failing here so we don’t fail there.

dialogues.speaker: KRAFT
dialogues.text: But at what cost?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Whatever it takes. the tense standoff, we PRELAP --

dialogues.speaker: KTRH ANCHOR, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: .-.the NASA press release said the ejection took place at 200 feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet stands by the stove, cooking. Or rather she was. No she LISTENS to the radio on the sill. PALE.

dialogues.speaker: KTRH ANCHOR, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: .--but eyewitnesses said Armstrong was much lower. Senator Mondale was particularly vocal on the loss of the multi-million dollar machine...  104. The door opens. Neil walks in, sees dinner isn’t on the table, starts to head towards his office when...

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Neil stops, turns. IMPENETRABLE.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: It’s always a sad day when you lose a machine. It’s hard to take; Janet needs more, but Neil’s distracte His eyes TICK to the radio.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR MONDALE, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: ...we’ve spent more than we did on the Manhattan project, we’ve put our most talented young men at risk, and what are the odds of success? Neil STIFFENS. Janet, visibly upset, turns back to the st The radio seems to grow LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR MONDALE, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Is it any wonder that a majority of the public no longer feel the space program is worth it? The front door SLAMS. Janet turns. Neil’s gone. INT. WOLFIE’S RESTAURANT, CAPE KENNEDY - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 60's diner. Neil eats alone, studying data from his LLT crash. He jots down a note and takes a bite of steak whic he’s cut into CUBES (so he can eat while he works). Neil’s so engrossed, he doesn’t hear THE MUSIC. Hendrix. Along the Watchtower. As it rolls past him, we RACK FOCUS a table of YOUNG HIPPIES. Facial hair, tie-dye, a box rad A GIRL in Joplin sunglasses (think Penny Lane) STARES at His cut up steak. His close cropped hair. His thin black tie. He’s a walking ANACHRONISM. The girl points. The others SNICKER. Neil doesn’t notice. PUSH IN on him, OBLIVIOUS. A man alone, out of time, but nonetheless hell bent, single minded, DETERMINED. His eye TICKING insistently, his focus UNWAVERING.
