That is, until A FILE is dropped in front of Neil. CONFIDENTIAL. Neil lo up, finds Deke. Who sits, nods at the file. Neil opens it  105. GRAINY PHOTOGRAPHS of a HUGE ROCKET. With RUSSIAN MARKING

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: It was unmanned. 2 million pounds of thrust. It circled the moon. Dammit.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: How long until we test the first stage of Saturn Five?

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Public support for Apollo has been dropping like a brick since the fire, Congress won’t fund us to be second best. Shit, we move too slow, they won’t fund us at all. Neil REALIZES...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We're testing all 3 stages at once. Deke nods. Holy shit. Even Neil is struck.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Apollo 8 will attempt to duplicate what the Soviets did. Lovell’s in command. You’re the backup. Kraft may not have been impressed by your tirade, but Gilruth was. At least my version of it. (standing) Get the new LLTV online asap. You, Conrad and Borman’1l rotate. If we actually manage to get there, one of you is gonna have to land. Deke leaves. Neil processes. He’s one of three men who mi land on the moon. Jesus. A beat, then we PULL BACK... HIGH AND WIDE on the DINER. The Hendrix, the hippies and anonymous astronaut... who very well might make history. We take in the oddity of the tableau, then CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crane lifts the ENORMOUS SECOND STAGE of a SATURN ROCKE We're in the 8-acre, 526-foot-tall hanger that is the V.A

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: Jesus, that’s a big mother.  106. MIKE COLLINS (38, shrewd) stands with Neil, Buzz, Lovell, and a few others as the crane sets the second stage atop first, which sits on the massive APOLLO CRAWLER-TRANSPORT

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Gonna be some kind of explosion if it goes up. (off the others) The MPAD guys said there’s a twenty percent chance.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL
dialogues.text: I’m gonna get some water. Lovell, a little pale, heads off towards the office.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: Shit, Buzz, he’s gotta fly that thing.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: It’s in the briefing pack. Dave turns towards Neil, surprised. And a bit AGITATED.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: You don’t think that’s a problem? This is exactly the kinda rush job that led to the fire. Neil doesn’t respond. Dave, annoyed, walks off after Love

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: He’s just pissed off cause he lost the lunar lottery.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER ASTRONAUT
dialogues.text: What? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: The LLTV rotation. The LLTV’s unstable, the only guys they’1l risk on it are the ones who actually might land. 3 commanders, 2 pilots. Neil doesn’t like this talk; neither do the others.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: You think you’re going to the moon?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: The landing’s been up for grabs ever since Gus and Ed died. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If 8 makes it there and back, 10, 11 or 12 is going to be the one. That’s Borman, Conrad or Neil. With Anders or me piloting. (off their reaction) What? I’m just saying what you're all thinking out loud.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Maybe you shouldn't. It's SHARP. Buzz turns, surprised. Before he can respond, the men see Lovell WAVING from the office. SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a RADIO CONSOLE. We hear COMMS. IN RUSSIAN.

dialogues.speaker: KOMAROV, (RUSSIAN, ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Activated, activated. GROUND (RUSSIAN, ON RADIO) Understood. Our comrades recommend a deep breath. Neil and the others join Lovell and Deke at the console. MILITARY AIDE/TRANSLATOR, 20s, explains.

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY TRANSLATOR
dialogues.text: The Japanese picked up the radio signal. A telemetry antenna and one of the solar arrays failed.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: Bad maiden run for the Soyuz.

dialogues.speaker: KOMAROV, (RUSSIAN, ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Orientation problems persist. (off the comms) He’s mid-retrofire.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: One wing, no telemetry, how’s he managing re-entry?

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY AIDE
dialogues.text: This is his third attempt.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELL
dialogues.text: Jesus. It's good news for our team. But no one’s smiling.

dialogues.speaker: KOMAROV, (RUSSIAN, ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Entering atmosphere... unable GROUND (RUSSIAN, ON RADIO) to control attitude... Center of gravity is off, you’re coming down too fast.  108. The men clock Komarov’s tone.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: What’s happening? MILITARY TRANSLATOR The Soyuz’s attitude is off, it’s not getting any lift.

dialogues.speaker: KOMAROV, (RUSSIAN, ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Nothing I lay my hands on GROUND (RUSSIAN, ON RADIO) works! Rubin, this is Zarya, deploy your drogue to slow descent!

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY TRANSLATOR
dialogues.text: He's deploying parachutes. DAVE SCOTT He’s gotta be coming in hot. They LEAN IN, the human element superseding the competiti

dialogues.speaker: KOMAROV, (RUSSIAN, ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Main parachute has fail... GROUND (RUSSIAN, ON RADIO) Didn’t get that. Can you re--

dialogues.speaker: KOMAROV, (RUSSIAN, ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Main parachute has fail... manually deploying reserve chute!

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY TRANSLATOR
dialogues.text: His main chute failed. LOVELL He’s got to have a reserve. They listen, TENSE... then Komarov starts to SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: KOMAROV, (RUSSIAN, ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: The release failed! The release... STATIC. The astronauts BLANCH.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND, (RUSSIAN, ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Rubin, this is Zarya, how do you hear me? Rubin, do you hear me? A beat. Nothing but STATIC on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY TRANSLATOR
dialogues.text: I... I think he’s crashed. The men look down. GRIM. All save for Neil. Who heads out

dialogues.speaker: DAVE SCOTT
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: More of a head start now. We should make use of it.  109. He exits. Off Dave, STUNNED, we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: COLOR FOOTAGE of ABC SCIENCE EDITOR JULES BERGMAN at the APOLLO 8 towering on the launch pad in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: JULES BERGMAN, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Good morning, I’m ABC Science Editor Jules Bergman at Cape Kennedy with a late status report on Apollo 8...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The broadcast continues but we’re now on the scene. Bergm sits at a desk in front of an ABC camera crew.

dialogues.speaker: JULES BERGMAN, (TO CAMERA)
dialogues.text: ..-Astronauts Borman, Lovell and Anders are in their command module, the first manned spacecraft to leave Earth’s orbit... The camera starts MOVING, PUSHING PAST Bergman to a HUGE OF HUMANITY; Apollo posters, bell bottoms, Sgt. Pepper... Woodstock for geeks. In the middle of it all, a NASA VAN rolls from the launch pad towards mission control. CUT IN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, Buzz and Fred Haise, the Apollo 8 backups, sit in b Buzz stares out the window, riveted, focusing on... PROTESTORS. We note the banners: Is space more important our poor? Our boys in Vietnam? Buzz sees the ANGER.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Nuts. Just nuts, huh? Buzz turns to Neil, reading a manual. COMPLETELY OBLIVIOU Off Buzz, clearly not understanding Neil at all, we CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Neil's eyes, now staring through the ENORMOUS WI of Launch Control at Apollo 8, steaming on the pad. In th b/g, the launch director runs through flight checks. Even at a distance, the Saturn is HUGE. And at 7.5 millio pounds of thrust, it’s the most powerful rocket in histor

dialogues.speaker: FIDO, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: T minus 1 minute.  110. As the flight crew sounds off, Deke joins Neil and looks the line.... at Dave’s jaw tensing, at Buzz scratching at neck, at Mike biting a nail... and then at Neil. Still.

dialogues.speaker: LAUNCH DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Final go, no go. EECOM? EECOM ENGINEER I’m go. Launch commit. The whole room QUIETS as the call continues.

dialogues.speaker: FIDO
dialogues.text: T minus ten, nine, eight, seven, main engine start... We SEE the engines FIRE before we HEAR them... Lights and ceiling tiles begin to SHAKE. A couple come CRASHING DOWN

dialogues.speaker: FIDO
dialogues.text: Four, three, two, one, ignition... We hear the engines ROAR. A TSUNAMI OF THUNDER SLAMS into windows, BUCKLING the big one in front of Neil. Holy Shit A number of men HIT THE DECK. Even Neil FLINCHES... But the window HOLDS. And Apollo 8 lifts off the pad. There's something TERRIFYING about the POWER of the big rocket, the SPEED at which it hurtles into the sky... ..-but as it continues to rise, there’s scattered CLAPPIN the launch is successful. And momentarily, everyone start CHEER. Everyone, that is, but Neil. Who heads for the doo Off Deke, CLOCKING THIS, we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Neil washing his hands. Concentrating. Methodica

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Helluva launch. Neil looks up. Deke’s walked in. Neil shrugs, turns back the sink. Deke looks at him for a moment. Scrutinizing hi

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: I talked with Chris and Bob about the schedule and we’d like you to command 11. Obviously, if 8 is successful, 11 or 12 will probably be our first attempt at a landing. Neil nods, pleased, but doesn’t acknowledge the potential momentous nature of the mission.  111.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Who are you thinking for the crew?

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Collins was cleared by the doc, he’s the best Command Module Pilot available. The Lunar Module Pilot, well, you could take Lovell, but it’s a quick turnaround. And he’s in line for his own command.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Who’s the other option?

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Buzz is the guy with the most experience. Neil considers.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Let me have 24 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clock reads 9pm. Neil’s hunched over a preliminary traini schedule for Apollo 11.

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: You beat me to the moon I’m gonna kick your ass. Conrad, leaving, holds up a PACKET. Labeled APOLLO 12.

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: I hear Deke’s trying to stick you with Aldrin. Neil shrugs. Conrad shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CONRAD
dialogues.text: If you can survive 8 days with him in that sardine can, power to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil heads out. He starts to turn into the elevator bank he spots a LIGHT ON down the hall. Curious, he walks on.. ...and finds an open door. Inside, Buzz pours over a desk full of DIAGRAMS, EQUATIONS, TRAJECTORIES for the lunar landing. Buzz is so focused he doesn’t even notice Neil. Off Neil, standing, watching Buzz, PROCESSING, CUT TO --  112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE MEN in GAS MASKS are led into a theater packed with reporters, pads and cameras ready. It’s ODD. Apollo 11, Pre-Flight Press Conference July 5, 1969 The men are led on stage to a TALL, THREE-SIDED PLASTIC B Fans are turned on to blow air TOWARDS THE AUDIENCE as th sit, take off the masks. It’s Neil, Mike Collins... and B Neil, STIFF, glances at Deke then walks to the podium.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We're here today to talk a bit about the forthcoming flight. We’re able to talk about it because of previous flights. Every flight took on new objectives and left us with very few additions to be completed. We’re grateful to those people who made it possible for us to sit here today. Neil sits, no trace of emotion. Deke takes the podium.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: We'll take questions now. Jim?

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: (standing) Neil, when you learned you were going to command this flight, were you surprised? Overjoyed?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: ...I was pleased.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Okay, but how would you compare this feeling with winning an automobile? Or being selected as an astronaut?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: (pause) I was pleased. The reporter isn’t pleased, but another jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSWEEK REPORTER
dialogues.text: Neil, were you aware that Ralph Abernathy is planning a protest for the day of the launch?  113.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: No. I was not.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSWEEK REPORTER
dialogues.text: He said, and I quote, “A fifth of this nation lives in poverty. In the face of such suffering, space flight represents an inhuman priority.” Do you have any comment?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: No. An awkward beat. Deke shoots Neil a look. fry harder.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Neil, if it does turn out, you’ll go down in history. What kind of thoughts do you have about that?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: (making an effort) Several people have mentioned that. I hope that you and the public will recognize the thing as a group effort because it really is that.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: But when a thought hits you; ‘Gosh, suppose that flight is successful’ --

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I’m planning on it being successful. Why do you always say ‘suppose that flight will be successful?’

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: ..-uh, I just meant, how you look at yourself as being part of history? Neil hesitates... and in that moment Buzz jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I think I can shed some light here. It’s a responsibility, but it’s exciting to be first. Even my wife is excited. She keeps slipping jewelry into my PPK. Some laughter. Neil looks ever so slightly IRRITATED.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: You're planning to take some of her jewelry to the moon, Buzz?  114.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Well, sure. What fella wouldn’t want to give his wife bragging rights? Buzz smiles, enjoying the limelight.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Neil, will you take anything?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: If I had a choice, I’d take more fuel. An awkward SILENCE. Then Mike LAUGHS. Reporters, relieved follow suit. But Neil doesn’t. Off Neil, UNCOMFORTABLE -- INT. NEIL AND JANET’S BEDROOM, ARMSTRONG HOUSE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a SUITCASE. Very tidy. FIND Neil packing. Methodical. Emotionless. A beat, then Janet walks in.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Come say good night to the boys. Neil keeps packing. A beat, then Janet reaches over, CLOS the suitcase. Neil looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: The boys want you to tuck them in.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I gotta pack. He starts to turn back but she GRABS his arm. FORCEFUL.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I'd like you to talk to the boys.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: (firm) I don’t have time.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Pat tried to commit suicide. Three days ago. Did you even know? She’s okay now. Okay as she’ll ever be. (then, off Neil) Everyday I pack your lunch, I make your dinner and I... I used to hope that someday I’d have something to show for it. I won’t. I know that now. And that’s fine. But Rick and Mark? What are the chances you’re coming back? 50 percent? 40? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JANET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are the chances it’s the last time they see you? (and then) You don’t have time? Make the fucking time. Off Neil, CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick (12) and Mark (6) both tucked in. Neil on Rick’s bed

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: So the trip is eight days?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (explaining to Mark) They’1l1 be quarantined when they get back, to make sure they haven’t picked up any moon germs.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: (worried) Are you scared, Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We've done everything before except for the actual landing.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: (beat) But why do you have to go? Neil hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Because we have to demonstrate we can do this. Mark doesn’t know what to make of that. Rick tries to hel

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Dad’s going to be famous.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: You are? Neil doesn’t like the question any more than he did from reporters. He’s quiet. An AWKWARD BEAT. Jan steps in.  116.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Okay, it’s time for bed. Relieved, Neil leaves. HOLD ON Janet. ALONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE on the house. A BLACK CAR idling by the curb. Neil comes to the door, duffel and a briefcase. He gives Janet perfunctory peck and walks to the car. ON JANET, watching as Neil hands off his duffel, gets in car and, without so much as a look back, shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil sits back in his seat. He pulls out a mission briefi starts to read as the driver gets back in the car. The car pulls off. In that moment, the tension LEAVES Nei face. He looks out the window, at the houses slipping awa and we see imperceptible RELIEF. The mission has begun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large campus, a maze of one story barracks. Cape Canaveral, 4:20 AM, July 16, 1969 It's DARK, save for a light from one low window. And QUIE save for a MUFFLED THUMPING. THA-THUMP. THA-THUMP. The sound takes us through the lit window into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a STETHOSCOPE. FIND Neil, shirtless, in front of flight surgeon. We hear Neil’s heart rate SPEED UP. Neil’ eyes TICK to the Doc. Is he concerned? A long beat, then.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: He’s clear. Send in Aldrin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil sits beside an odd flower centerpiece, working his w through steak and eggs. Like it’s any other day.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? Deke eats breakfast with Neil and the two other astronaut He’s staring at Buzz, SIGNING multiple PHOTOS OF HIMSELF.  117.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Life insurance. Mine was denied. (passing them to Deke) Would you get these to Jean Ann? Mike reacts. Seriously? Unnerved, he glances at Neil, but Neil just keeps eating, totally unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: GILRUTH, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. The men look up. Gilruth stands in the doorway, waiting. It’s time. As Neil stands, we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deke leads the men into the ready room. Multiple techs sw around THREE ASTRONAUT SPACESUITS. 5:30 AM (Tf minus 4 hours, 3 minutes) As the men start to strip down, we see A SERIES of QUICK Tape SEALS up a DIAPER around a man’s waist. A MESH of LIQUID-COOLING TUBES are FILLED with water; a Z CLOSES the thin, nylon one-piece containing them. A ZIPPER CLOSES the internal pressure suit; a ‘SLIDE FAST ZIPS it shut; then a THERMAL SKIN is VELCROED on top of t METALLIC RINGS SNAP ON one glove, then another; SLEEVES a ROLLED over the rings. A COMMS (SNOOPY) CAP chin-strap is SNAPPED in place; its is PLUGGED INTO the top of the suit. An AIR NOZZLE is TWISTED ONTO the BLUE PORTAL on the fron a spacesuit; we hear the HISS of air as... A HELMET is PLACED on the head of a PRETERNATURALLY CALM The helmet SWIVELS into place and the sound FADES... ...we hear only the HISS OF OXYGEN as Neil CLOSES HIS EYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Neil, eyes still closed. The HISS of air pervade 6:45 AM (T minus 2 hours, 48 minutes)  118. Neil opens his eyes, takes in the ENORMOUS SATURN V ROCKE beside him. He rises quickly up its side on the high spee elevator with Buzz and Mike (suited up) and Deke. And we can’t help but notice the FLOCK OF PRESS VANS belo the HORDE OF MEDIA AND SPECTATORS stretching out before t

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Guess we have a couple fans. Even Mike and Buzz find it STAGGERING. But for Neil it’s DEEPLY UNSETTLING. He looks away, eyes TICKING to the checklist on his wrist, FOCUSING on it as only he can... +..until the elevator JERKS to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Ready? Neil looks up. The door SWINGS opens. They've reached SWI ARM 9, which leads to the white room and the command modu Neil grabs his oxygen tank and leads the others onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil walks forward, eyes on the CAPSULE. Techs scurry, we hear chatter over comms, but it’s FAINT, SUBSUMED by the hiss of oxygen and Neil’s INTENSE FOCUS on the task ahead This is a solitary moment. Neil barely noticing as a tech walks up to help him with his oxygen tank. Neil hands his tank to the tech, blinks... the tech looks like ELLIOT. Neil turns away... and spots a_tech who looks like ED. Neil pauses. PUSH IN on his face, his eyes... as he CLOSE them. The HISSING grows louder and we PRELAP FAINT COMMS

dialogues.speaker: LAUNCH DIRECTOR, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: The leaky hydrogen valve on the 200 foot level shouldn’t be a problem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil. Eyes closed. T minus 2 hours 10 minutes

dialogues.speaker: LAUNCH DIRECTOR, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: We’re powering up the console now.  119. His eyes BLINK OPEN as the lights on the console FLASH ON Neil’s strapped into the capsule. Buzz and Mike beside hi

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Console on. We’re go to close up. The techs move to close the hatch but Deke leans in.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Give me a second. (to Neil, COMMS) .--We thought about a pill but we realized if the landing goes south and you get stranded you can just...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Purge the suits, go to sleep. Neil’s thought it through, he isn’t fazed at all. Deke reacts. SURPRISINGLY EMOTIONAL, he GRABS Neil’s gloved ha

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Make us proud. Deke exits. The techs move in to close the hatch, COVERIN the front window with a PROTECTIVE SHIELD. We HOLD ON the three men in the tight, CLAUSTROPHOBIC cabin. An odd quiet. Eerily punctuated by a loud HISS.

dialogues.speaker: LAUNCH CONTROL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Pressurizing the cabin. NEIL (INTO COMMS) Proceeding to checks. Running Emergency Detection system. Neil, seemingly oblivious to the stifling atmosphere, sta into checks with the others and we see A SERIES OF QUICK HANDS flipping through the Flight Plan and the Mission Ru FINGERS flicking switches, punching buttons. EYES ticking from the books to the console to the clock.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (0.C., INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Arming escape rocket... NEIL (0.C., INTO COMMS) Checking Propulsion System...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (0.C., INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Arming hand controllers. BUZZ (O.C., INTO COMMS) Finalizing Stabilization...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (0.C., INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Full internal power.  120. A FINAL FLURRY of BUTTONS DEPRESSED, LIGHTING UP, of SWIT FLIPPED ON and we arrive at...

dialogues.speaker: FIDO, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: T minus 2 minutes. LAUNCH DIRECTOR (COMMS) Final Pre-launch sequence. The men sit, nothing to do but wait. Neil is BLANK, but w FEEL the nervous anticipation of Buzz and Mike because... we’re not going anywhere. WE’RE GONNA STAY WITH THE CREW THE WHOLE DAMN MISSION. So buckle the fuck up...

dialogues.speaker: CRAFT TEST CONDUCTOR, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Personnel status check LAUNCH OPS MANAGER (COMMS) complete, all go. Operations is go for launch.

dialogues.speaker: TEST SUPURVISOR, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Test supervisor, go for LAUNCH DIRECTOR (COMMS) launch. We are on the automatic sequence. Final abort checks. PUSH _IN on Neil, hand on the ABORT HANDLE. Seemingly CAL

dialogues.speaker: FIDO, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: 60 seconds and counting. LAUNCH DIRECTOR (COMMS) All is still go. Propellant tanks pressurized, oxidizer tanks now have pressurized. PUSH IN FURTHER on Neil’s EYES. Dark. INTENSE. A WEALTH o EMOTIONS. We HOLD ON NEIL’S EYES as the call continues...

dialogues.speaker: FIDO, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: T minus 30 seconds. LAUNCH DIRECTOR (COMMS) 3rd stage tanks pressurized, readings indicate we are go.

dialogues.speaker: FIDO, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: 20 seconds... LAUNCH DIRECTOR (COMMS) 2nd stage tanks pressurized, guidance is now internal...

dialogues.speaker: FIDO, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: T minus 10, 9, ignition sequence... We hear a LOUD RUMBLING from far below as the capsule beg to shake. HOLD ON Neil. Steady. Unyielding.

The noise gets LOUDER... the ROAR of 7.5 MILLION POUNDS O THRUST SLAMMING into the ground DROWNS OUT the countdown.  121. The capsule BUCKS violently, SLAMMING Neil back in his se It's FAR WORSE THAN GEMINI. Even Neil is STARTLED, but he WILLS himself to FOCUS, eyes TICKING RAPIDLY from clock t console as the ROAR goes on, the cockpit continues to SHA Neil glances to his right... Buzz looks TENSE, Mike looks BEWILDERED... no sense of whether they've lifted off... Can this possibly be what it's supposed to feel like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil’s eyes TICK to his CHECKLIST... ROLL AT 15 SECONDS. glances at the clock, PUNCHES in the maneuver... and we F the rocket ROLL, g-forces so INTENSE all three men turn G Neil PUSHES THROUGH, eyes GLUED to the instruments as, at last, the roar FADES and, faintly, we hear COMMS...

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Mode 1 Charlie. Go for staging. Neil nods to Buzz. He hits a switch and the roar QUIETS.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Inboard cut off. (inputs sequence) Staging... and ignit-- BOOM! The men are SLAMMED back into their seats... but th shaking quickly FADES to an UNSETTLING QUIET as the secon stage propels them out of the atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s SURPRISINGLY SERENE until... BANG! Neil hits a button and the escape rocket and protec shield are JETTISONED. BLUE SKY appears in the window.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Skirt SEP, tower's gone. CAPCOM (COMMS) Roger. We confirm.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: They finally gave us a window. The small square of blue is a RELIEF... but Mike’s smile as the blue sky RAPIDLY TURNS BLACK... MUCH FASTER than G or in the X-15. It’s TERRIFYING, but Neil ignores it...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Prep for TLI. Pyros armed? BUZZ (INTO COMMS) 4 breakers in, switches up. Buzz punches a ready button... and gets no response. He h the button a few more times... it finally flicks ON.  122.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) CAPCOM (COMMS) State of the art. 11, you are go for Translunar Injection. No, there’s no time for commentary. Mike eyes a STOPWATCH

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: 5, 4, 3, 2, 1... ignition. Neil HITS the throttle. A FLASH out the window and they’r PRESSED BACK in their seats again. It’s smooth, if JARRIN

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: We confirm ignition, thrust is go. Neil and Buzz monitor the burn, but Mike is DISTRACTED. H motions to Buzz, who turns. And sees SPARKS. Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Flashes out window five, could be something with the engine. The engine? Shit. Mike PALES as a console light FLASHES.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Pushing past earth gravity, we’re 10 feet-per-second off! The capsule SHAKES. Neil just works a CALCULATOR, CALM. M stares: Is it that he’s not worried? Or that he doesn’t c

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Yaw, Mike. Neil holds his calculations out to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: 5... 5 seconds to nominal. (off Neil’s numbers) .-.do that?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Yes, we better do that. Mike reacts to the SLIGHT URGENCY in Neil’s voice. He qui makes the adjustment. Neil hits the stick and POP! They’r HURLED against their harnesses into MICROGRAVITY.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: We have cut-off. The men catch their breath, pull off their helmets. As Ne takes a reading, Buzz's helmet FLOATS across the cabin. H reaches for it, spots the VISTA in the window...  123. NOTHING BUT SPACE. Earth is far behind already, they're o dark and lonely sea. It’s AWESOME. And TERRIFYING.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Residuals at 3.3 on the delta.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Good burn, good focus, Neil. MIKE COLLINS (INTO COMMS) Houston, do you copy? No answer from Houston. Mike leans in again.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: Houston, you read? Do you read 11? Still no answer. Buzz and Mike trade a look, the silence CHILLING. Neil, unconcerned, jots down residuals, then --

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Let's prep for separation.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: We should wait until we re-establish contact. Mission Rules say we wait. But Neil ignores him, starts PUNCHING BUTTONS. Buzz, surprised, takes the comms from Mike.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Houston? Houston, you read us? Still nothing. Neil keeps prepping.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Want to help me out, Mike? Mike is UNEASY, unsure what to do. An AWKWARD BEAT, then.

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: 11, Houston. Do you read? 11? Buzz and Mike trade a look. RELIEVED.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Roger, Houston. We read an CAPCOM (COMMS) EMS plus 3.3. Over. Roger. It looks like you are well on your way now. But Buzz and Mike pause, TROUBLED. Watching Neil. There's escaping what transpired. And there's no turning back.

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Apollo 11, you’re go for separation.  124. Mike and Buzz snap to, ready for the maneuver.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Pyro B coming armed. BUZZ (INTO COMMS) Vehicle SEP pushbutton.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Here we go. Thrusting... and SEP. Neil hits the PYROS. The LOUD CRACK of the pyro explosion surprises the crew and SMASH TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM AFAR we see the explosion RIP OFF four panels connec the Command Service Module (CSM) to the Saturn’s third st It’s JARRING. Was that planned? We watch the panels FLOAT off as the CSM and what’s left of the Saturn race on towa the moon. The quiet is eerie, UNNERVING, until...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Okay. I see a SLA panel going out. Go for turn and dock. RCS jets FIRE in four directions. In a THRILLING LONG SHO the CSM slowly ROTATES 180 degrees, nosing towards what's of the Saturn rocket... and the LUNAR MODULE (LM) within.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: We need a 5 degree right, Mike... It’s a STUNNING BALLET, the CSM shifting, INCHING forward

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Capture probe, extend/release. A small PROBE extends from the CSM’s nose, SCRAPING the L NAILS on a chalkboard. Is something wrong? For a beat, we wonder... then the LM’s DROGUE latches on. Both crafts SH

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m go for retract. NEIL (COMMS) Docking probe, retract. The CSM gently PULLS the LM free of the Saturn, its FAMOU ORANGE HULL SHIMMERING in the sunlight. It's BREATHTAKING

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Beginning solar rotation. Slowly, the COMBINED CRAFT starts ROTATING, speeding BACK towards the moon. We PAN around the ship... PUSH down the side, CUTTING INTO --  125.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks to the earth, FURTHER AWAY than he’s ever seen and SWIFTLY RECEDING into the distance... the magnitude o what they're doing now clear. It's HUMBLING. FRIGHTENING.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: Wish I’d thought to bring music. Neil reaches into the hold, pulls out an 8-TRACK and floa to Mike. Mike surprised, grabs the 8-track, hits play as grabs a SEXTANT, starts checking their alignment... We hear the 2nd movement of DVORAK'S NEW WORLD SYMPHONY. purposeful, optimistic opening giving way to drums and a LONELY CLARINET. It SWIRLS around the men... ...and now Buzz stops working, catching sight of the RECE EARTH in the window. He and Mike STARE, struck by how FRA the earth looks, how SMALL. Mike glances at Neil, taking readings, checking calculati not taking even a moment to note the majesty or the grand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the HAUNTING CLARINET moves us through time and space, earth getting smaller in the window, Neil fails to notice As he mechanically lifts ELLIOT’S SEXTANT for another rea

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO --
dialogues.text: MISSION DAY THREE (00:29:36). CLOSE ON a small compartmen door closing and a hand writing on it. SMELLY WASTE. REVEAL Mike, GRIMY flight suit, thick STUBBLE, red eyes. floats past wires taped with soiled duct tape over to a g CALENDAR scrawled on the wall. He crosses off day 3 of 9. Mike wipes his brow, already sick of the DANK cabin and f over to Buzz and Neil (flight suits, stubble). They hover over a TOPOGRAPHICAL MAP of the moon.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: .-.the landing area is beyond the Maskelyne series, it should be flat. Which is good cause you won’t have much wiggle room. That fuel tank’s a bitch, if you’re not under 100 feet at 20 seconds to bingo --

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We will be.  126. He's dismissive. Buzz notes it. Uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Hate to interrupt, but we’ve played back the LOI 2 burn, it looks good, we got an orbit at 65.4 by 53.9. As he says it, a DARK OBJECT fills THREE QUARTERS of the window. It’s our first close view of THE MOON, its barren surface STARK and FORBODING. As the men take it in, CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The craft floats BACKWARDS in orbit around the moon.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Man, look at it. The moon is no longer an image in the window but a FULL-S PLANETARY BODY. The sight of the craft orbiting it is bot viscerally REAL and unbelievably UNREAL. It's STARTLING.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Boy, look at that son of a bitch. Mike's voice PULLS US BACK INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Buzz stare out at the moon, in AWE... but Neil’s already focused on what’s next.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Buzz. (points, all business) We just passed Mount Marilyn. We're coming up on Maskelyne series, coming into the landing area. We roll right here at this... that crater, the big one. Duke Island.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: ...that’s US 1, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: The flat area, that’s our target.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Sure is eerie looking.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: There must be nothing more desolate than inside some of these craters.  127. They stare. Buzz and Mike clearly both ANTSY.

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Apollo 11, this is Houston, do you read? The spacecraft is looking good to us on telemetry. Flight is requesting a burn status report. Mike and Buzz move to comply, but Neil stares out the win PUSH IN on his eyes, resolved. More INTENSE then ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabin lights are dim. Mike TAPES UP the windows to ke out the sunlight and the bright moonshine.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: I thought today went pretty well. If tomorrow and the next day are like today, we'll be safe.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Absolutely. The camera FLOATS DOWN to the lower deck, Buzz and Neil stretched out in floating hammocks. Buzz is chatty, TENSE

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Helluva sight out there. You know what you'll say if we manage to land? It’s an historic moment.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We should sleep. It's ABRUPT. As Buzz, AFFRONTED, closes his eyes, we PAN to Neil and PUSH IN on his EYES. WIDE OPEN. Tired, but TICKING up and down, reading something. TILT UP to... A MAP OF THE LUNAR LANDING AREA taped to the ceiling. We ON it for a beat... ...then PAN BACK DOWN to Neil. Still studying the map.

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Apollo 11, Apollo 11. Good morning from the Black Team. We've TIME CUT... the day is upon us. Neil’s eyes now SUN but we see the ADRENALINE PUMPING. As he sits up, we CUT  128.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, ON EDGE, works a fuel cell purge, a camera set up a auto maneuver. Neil collects his pack, preps to enter the

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: All this food and stuff up here, you going to take it with you? Chewing gum, you want any of that? Neil shakes him off. Mike, sweaty, wrestles a storage bin

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: This is a damn three-ring circus. I got a fuel cell purge in progress, I gotta watch an AUTO maneuver and -- The storage bin POPS open, film rolls FLOAT in all direct

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: (trying to grab them) Christ! You son of a bitch, you!

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Mike. Mike tries to SETTLE, clearly nervous about being left al

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: Come back, will you? Neil nods, grabs his PLSS pack and FLOATS TO the open hat the TOP of the CSM. STAY WITH NEIL as he FLOATS INTO -- THE CONNECTING TUNNEL. We look up... from Neil’s POV, Buz STANDING UPSIDE DOWN in the Lunar Module. It's DISORIENTI Neil BLINKS away the vertigo, pulls himself into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Neil in, ROTATING with him until what was just upside down is RIGHT SIDE UP. Neil glances at Mike, now upside down in the CSM, then closes the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Columbia, Eagle. Have you got the -- got to the tunnel vent step yet?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: I’m just coming to that. BUZZ (INTO COMMS) Well, we're waiting on you. Buzz, ANTSY, looks at Neil, calmly stowing his gear.  129.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I heard Conrad was taking bets before we left. He told me our odds were about 10 to 1. The guy actually had the audacity to ask me which way I wanted to bet. Neil doesn’t say anything. It makes Buzz MORE FIDGETY.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: I’m going to start to depressurize. We got just about a minute to go, you guys all set? Buzz looks to Neil. Neil nods.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Maneuver us to undocking MIKE COLLINS (COMMS) attitude. Roger. We hear the CSM THRUSTERS repositioning the combined craf the moon TURNING SLOWLY in the window.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Maneuver on target. 15 seconds. Neil reaches for the throttle. PUSH IN on his tired eyes. JUMP CUT to his WATCH... seconds ticking by... until at l we HEAR the probe above them RETRACT.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: There you go. Neil PUSHES the thruster. The LM slowly moves from the CS

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Eagle, we see you on the steerable. Neil looks towards the waiting moon. PUSH OUT INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM AFAR we see the LM slowly BREAKING AWAY from the CSM

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Roger. The Eagle has wings. The gas jets ROTATE the LM, pointing the landing gear for

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Go for powered descent. MIKE COLLINS (COMMS) Go for PDI, Eagle.  130.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Roger. We read you. But Buzz sounds CONCERNED as we PUSH BACK INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil STRUGGLES with a BREAKER on the console. It’s come LOOSE, Neil tries to JAM it back into place.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: ...cottonpicker won’t stay. CAPCOM (COMMS) Eagle, Houston. Alignment is go. One minute to ignition.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: We should report the breaker. Neil doesn’t respond, just keeps working on it.

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: 40 seconds. BUZZ Protocol says we should -- BANG! Neil POUNDS the breaker back in. It stays.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Let’s prep for descent. Neil gets to work, like nothing happened. For a moment, B stands, staring... UNEASY, knowing his life’s in Neil’s h

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: 20 seconds. (focusing) Altitude lights on. Proceed. Neil eyes his stopwatch again... the seconds TICK by...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: 3, 2, 1, 0... ignition. Neil eases the throttle forward and the lunar module LURC ahead... towards the surface.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Rate of descent looks good. Neil's eyes TICK across the console; we’ve seen it before now he’s PUSHING THROUGH fatigue, running on ADRENALINE..

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: We went by the 3 minute point early... a little off.  131.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Rate of descent looks good, altitude rate looks right down the groove.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Our position checks downrange show us to be a little off... A button on the console FLASHES ON. 1202. It beeps softly

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Program alarm. 1202...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Houston, give us a reading on CAPCOM (COMMS) the 1202 program alarm. Roger. A long beat. The beeping seems to grow LOUDER. Neil's eye TICK RAPIDLY from the alarm to his DROPPING ALTITUDE GAUG

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: We got... STATIC. Fuck. The alarm seems to grow LOUDER, DEAFENING.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Houston, come in. Houston... CAPCOM (COMMS) ...we’re go on that alarm. Buzz, relieved, shuts it off. Neil checks his instruments

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: 5000 feet, attitude control’s good. Another button FLASHES ON. The same BEEPING again...

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Same alarm. Neil reacts, uncharacteristically ANNOYED. Buzz shuts it

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS, STATIC)
dialogues.text: Eagle, you’re... go, repeat, you’re go for landing. BUZZ (INTO COMMS) Roger. Go for landing. A THIRD ALARM beeps. A new one. This time Neil IGNORES it

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Program alarm, 1201. It’s in core. But Neil keeps flying. The beeping PERVADES the tiny spac  132.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Houston, program alarm 1201. (to Neil) We should slow our descent. Neil ignores him. Buzz sees the moon RISING UP to meet th

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Neil, we need to slow our -- CAPCOM (COMMS ) 1201 alarm, go for landing. Same type. As Buzz shuts off the alarm, Neil looks out the window, e TICKING over the surface below... and then NARROWING.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Just past Maskelyne now... pretty rocky area. NEIL'S POV. The landing area is not flat. There’s a HUGE CRATER, A HUNDRED YARDS ACROSS. Surrounded by GIANT BOULD THERE’S NO CLEAR AREA FOR LANDING.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Jesus. We can’t land there. Neil makes a QUICK DECISION, PUSHES on the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Switching to manual control. We hear the POP and HISS of the Descent Propulsion System (DPS) as the craft RUSHES FORWARD. Buzz eyes the gauges..

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Copy. We have enough fuel? Neil doesn’t respond. Buzz does some quick calculations.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Not sure we have enough fuel to clear the area. Neil?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: What’s the LPD? Buzz glances at Neil, who remains focused on the surface.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ NEIL
dialogues.text: Did you hear -- What's the LPD? Buzz hesitates. Then gives Neil what he needs.  133.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: 47 degrees, 400 feet, down to 9. Neil eases the thruster forward. The DPS HISSES as they p over the rocky terrain. Buzz watches the PROPULSION CONSO CLOSE ON the FUEL NUMBER. DROPPING. 12, 11, 10...

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS, STATIC)
dialogues.text: We see you’ve... manual... give an update, Eagle? Neil doesn't say a thing. He remains focused, INTENT.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: 300 down, 47 forward... MIKE COLLINS (COMMS) What’s going on there? You keeping an eye on your fuel? Neil grips the throttle, eyes TICKING FURIOUSLY from the window to the ALTITUDE GAUGE. As the DPS HISSES... RACK FOCUS to Buzz, UNSETTLED, staring at the propulsion console. CLOSE ON the fuel numbers. 8, 7, 6...

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Fuel is getting low. Neil IGNORES him. Buzz CLOCKS Neil’s intensity... and at moment he knows. Neil's landing this ship one way or anot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNNERVED, nothing to do but help, Buzz continues the call

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: 250, down at 2, 19 forward. Buzz sees the fuel numbers have DROPPED BELOW 5.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: 160 feet, 6 down, 9 forward. MIKE COLLINS (COMMS) Your fuel’s below low level! Neil keeps going, even as the FUEL QUANTITY LIGHT FLASHES

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: 120 feet, 3 down, 9 forward, NEIL fuel is at five perc -- I_understand. There’s FIRE in Neil’s eyes, DETERMINATION, an ABJECT REF TO ABORT. Jesus. Buzz TENSES.

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS, STATIC)
dialogues.text: ---45 seconds to Bingo. MIKE COLLINS (COMMS, STATIC) You need to consider abort--  134. Neil ignores him, eases the throttle forward.

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS, STATIC)
dialogues.text: 30 seconds to Bingo. Neil? Neil eyes TICK from the gauges to the window in front of him... it’s unclear whether he’s even LISTENING anymore.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Neil... MIKE COLLINS (COMMS, STATIC) ...you’re almost out of fuel. Neil remains unresponsive. The hiss is DEAFENING. Buzz lo from Neil to the FUEL GAUGE, eyes filled with ANXIETY.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Position. Buzz, disconcerted, just stares at the FLASHING FUEL GAUG

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS, STATIC)
dialogues.text: 20 seconds to Bingo. NEIL Position. Buzz! Buzz blinks, refocuses. He checks their position.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: 90 feet, down a half. DUST SWIRLS up from the lunar surface. Buzz glances at th fuel. CLOSE ON the numbers. 3, 2... FUCK. Buzz’s eyes WID

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: 50 feet down... picking up MIKE COLLINS (COMMS) dust, drifting right... 10 seconds, Neil!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: 20 feet, down a half, drifting forward just a little bit... And then, before they realize what's happening, a GREEN L FLASHES on the console. Buzz blinks in DISBELIEF.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Contact light. NEIL Shutdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, SPENT, lets the throttle SLIP from his hands. He fl the switch. The dust starts to settle and we see... ...the LUNAR SURFACE stretching out in front of them. Nei stares, BLANK. Buzz is completely STUNNED. A beat, then B recovers, starts powering down the LM.  135.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Engine stop; ACA out of CAPCOM (COMMS) DETENT. ...copy you down, Eagle.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Houston, Tranquility Base here. The Eagle has landed. An ENORMOUS CHEER goes up in Mission Control. Neil FLINCH It’s VISCERAL; something about it hits him right in the g

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Roger, tranquility.... copy... You got a lotta guys about to turn blue. We’re breathing again, thanks a lot. Neil sits, struggling to process. Buzz extends a shaky ha

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Very smooth touchdown. Neil, AWKWARD, nods. PUSH IN on his eyes, deep PAIN and J battling within and we hear a familiar HISS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Neil’s eyes. Staring ahead as he puts his helmet He snaps the helmet into place then reaches for a glove. snaps it on. Meticulous, careful... cognizant of the DANG of the lunar surface and the enormity of the moment. Neil reaches for a second glove when Buzz, struggling wit PLSS in the small cabin, JOSTLES him. The force pushes Ne towards the thin wall of the LM... ..-we hear a small SNAP... and just as it seems Neil migh through the wall he GRABS the ceiling and stops himself.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Sorry... Neil looks to see what snapped... can’t find anything. No entirely satisfied, he nonetheless returns to the task at hand, putting on his on PLSS and connecting the oxygen tu We hear a familiar HISS as Neil takes a beat, eyeing a PA clipped to the wall, a SCRIBBLED SENTENCE. One small step We can’t make out all the words, but we know what it says  136.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Ready? Buzz is fully suited up. Neil nods and Buzz opens a valve Through the window, we see the AIR in the LM VENTING OUT. It's nerve-wracking, all that air disappearing into space A long beat... then it STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Lunar module depressurized. Buzz reaches for the hatch... but it won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Damn thing. NEIL (INTO COMMS) Too much pressure in here. Buzz pulls again, harder.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Shit. NEIL (INTO COMMS) Don’t rupture it. Buzz stops. FRUSTRATED. Then something occurs to him... H reaches up and PEELS BACK a small part of the flimsy door hear a slight HISS. Then the door easily PULLS OPEN... ..-revealing the gray, barren surface below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and Buzz STARE, taking in the world outside the door In this moment, we understand how odd, how UNDENIABLY STR it is to be parked on the surface of another heavenly bod Neil lumbers forward, towards the hatch. PUSH IN on him, bevy of emotions flickering across his face... ...a face we HOLD ON as he lowers his feet through the ha climbing down the ladder to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Neil, sweat on his brow as he SHIMMIES down the ladder, down towards the new world. He remains focused, e on the LADDER, HANDS, FEET, until he reaches the final ru He stares out, a million things going through his mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ODDNESS of it all... the DESOLATE BEAUTY... the years work and sacrifice... and Elliot... and Ed... ...and now he catches a glimpse of the EARTH off on the horizon... hovering there... and the MAJESTY of it... the GLORY of what he’s done... it almost OVERWHELMS him.  137.

dialogues.speaker: CAPCOM, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Okay, Neil, we can see you coming down the ladder now. Neil tries to keep it together, STRUGGLING THROUGH...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: I’m, uh, at the foot of the ladder, the LEM footbeds are only uh... depressed in the surface about... uh, one or two inches. I’m gonna step off the LEM now. And now he takes that little hop down ONTO THE MOON... od DISCONNECTED from the moment, the rote line he’s memorize

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: That’s one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind... PUSH IN on Neil, STILL STRUGGLING. The COMMS FADE and he forward... turning from the golden, glimmering lunar modu ...to the BEAUTIFUL BLUE PLANET hovering just above the horizon. And now he finds he’s UNABLE TO CONTROL HIMSELF. A TEAR FALLS. A bevy of emotions rising to the surface... Pain. Joy. Loss. Triumph. All swirling round until the tears come FREELY, raining down with all the pent up feel It's the first and last such outburst we'll ever see.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (PRELAP, COMMS)
dialogues.text: Beautiful view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz lumbers across the lunar surface to Neil, who’s stil staring out at the earth. The LM shimmers in the backgrou

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Isn't that something. Magnificent.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Magnificent desolation. The words RESONATE. As Neil takes it all in, we, like Nei are humbled before the MAJESTY of space. The last ten years flicker before us, not in flashback, b the depths of Neil’s eyes. And for a moment, the WONDER t makes us feel like maybe, just maybe, it was all worth it  138. Off the view from the mountaintop, the LOOK in Neil’s eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil’s eyes are FOCUSED, his face sweating.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Neil? PULL BACK to find Neil walking, or rather LOPING, away fr the Eagle. Buzz, standing by the American Flag in the far b/g, watches... Confused. Neil keeps moving... until he comes to the edge of a CRAT He surveys it. Deep and vast, it’s like nothing we’ve see

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Neil, we need to get back. A beat. Then Neil UNZIPS a pocket in the front of his sui He reaches in, pulls out a few items and looks down at th An APOLLO 1 PATCH - GRISSOM WHITE CHAFFEE. ELLIOT’S SEXTA And finally a SMALL BRACELET. That of a little girl. PUSH IN on Neil’s eyes, on the PAIN. A beat, then Neil TH the three tokens far as he can... Off Neil, watching them soar on and on and on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and Buzz stand in the LM, the hatch closed, brushing other off. Moon dust swirls, slowly falling to the floor. last, they take off their helmets... and start COUGHING. The COUGHING takes us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil preps for liftoff in his flight suit, still COUGHING

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: ATT Control, 2 minutes to... for the guidance steering in the AGS.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: On. Right?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: Right. Master arm, Engine arm on?  139. Neil pauses. Buzz sees Neil examining the engine arm swit It’s BROKEN. Just a small stub. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Must’ve hit it when I got MIKE COLLINS (COMMS) out. One minute to launch. If they can’t fix it, they can’t get off the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz STARES. Shit shit shit. Neil bends down, examines th stub. Buzz eyes the clock. 50 seconds... 45 seconds...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: You got a pen? Takes Buzz a moment, then he floats a PEN over to Neil. N grabs it, jams it beside the stub. And pulls... Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL MIKE COLLINS, (COMMS)
dialogues.text: Dammit. 30 seconds. A tense beat. Neil tries again. And again...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: 20 seconds. Fuck. Neil SHOVES the pen in deeper... and PULLS... +.-until at last we hear a CLICK. The light FLASHES. ENGI ARMED. Buzz takes a breath, his face FLOODING with relief

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Got your ascent card? Recovering, Buzz preps for launch. Neil does too, but his focus is FARAWAY, eyes LINGERING on the lunar horizon...

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (INTO COMMS)
dialogues.text: 15... 10, 9, 8, 7, 6, 5, abort stage - engine arm, ascent, proceed... Neil HITS the thrusters. DUST kicks up as the ship ROCKS AND FORTH, lifting off the surface... casting a LONG SHAD it slowly rises above the moon...

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Look at that shadow. Beautiful! HOLD ON Neil's eyes, watching the moon fall away. As we d we hear familiar voices from a television broadcast...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER CRONKITE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: It may not be a beauty one can pass on to future beholders. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WALTER CRONKITE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: These first men on the moon can see something that men who follow will miss... PUSH IN on Neil. Staring out at the moon.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC SEVAREID, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Yes, we're always going to feel, somehow, strangers to these men. Off Neil, we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ship of men, watch, excited, as the Apollo Capsule parachutes down from the skies...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC SEVAREID, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: They will, in effect be a bit stranger... even to their own wives and children...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, Buzz and Mike, covered in FULL BODY CONTAMINATION S are helped out of the floating capsule and onto a small s

dialogues.speaker: ERIC SEVAREID, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: .--disappeared into another life that we can't follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men, in contamination suits, are walked across a lowe deck to the QUARANTINE AIRSTREAM that awaits. The enter i

dialogues.speaker: ERIC SEVAREID, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I wonder what their life will be like, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The QUARANTINE AIRSTREAM is moved onto an ARMY TRUCK...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC SEVAREID, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: The moon treated them well... From ARMY TRUCK to AIR FORCE PLANE...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC SEVAREID, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: How people on earth will treat these men, the rest of their lives... From AIR FORCE PLANE to ANOTHER AIR FORCE TRUCK...  141.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC SEVAREID, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: That gives me more foreboding, I think, than anything else... ...and at last to the MSC QUARANTINE FACILITY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JANET. In back, staring out the window. As the car pul ahead, we hear a DULL ROAR. Janet’s eyes WIDEN. REVERSE T THE MSC ENTRANCE. A THRONG OF PEOPLE around a HUGE DISPLA FLOWERS and SIGNS, the pride PALPABLE. Janet TEARS UP.

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT SURGEON, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: We'll keep them in quarantine for the full three weeks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLIGHT SURGEON leads Janet down a lackluster hall.

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT SURGEON, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: ...-but none of the tests have shown any sign of infection or disease. They reach a door, an ARMY GUARD. Janet’s escort hands hi papers and the guard opens the door. They walk into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NASA logo. And a GLASS WALL. On the other side of it, a large room, Neil stands in a flight suit. Alone. Janet, relieved, walks to the glass. Neil looks at her, b his eyes are FARAWAY. Impossibly distant. Janet TIGHTENS. HOLD ON the two of them, as far apart as they’ve ever bee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a SEA of MAGAZINES and NEWSPAPERS: TIME, LIFE, t NEW YORK TIMES... All with front page coverage of Apollo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND BUZZ hovering over it all, staring at a TV. MESMERIZ Neil walks in. Glances at the TV, reporters asking people where they were when Apollo 11 landed on the moon.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Have you seen this? Can you believe it? The entire world was watching. We missed the whole damn thing. Buzz shakes his head. He looks LOST. Off Neil, processing  142.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three BLACK CARS parked in front of the building. Doors o and Mike, Buzz and Neil exit with duffels, MILITARY ESCOR The men BREATHE IN the fresh air... then walk to the cars

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil sits in back, quiet, as the car pulls up to the MSC The escort beside him rolls down the window, hands papers GUARD. He starts to wave them through... but can't resist

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Mr. Armstrong, you make us proud. Neil nods, AWKWARD. The escort rolls up the window and th driver pulls forward. A beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: ESCORT
dialogues.text: He’s right, you’re a real hero. I bet you’re the most famous man in the world. Neil gives the escort a tight smile, his eyes TICKING to NEWS VAN that starts to tail them. Off Neil, TENSE, CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town car turns off the main road into a suburban development. THREE NEWS VANS now follow behind. INSIDE THE CAR Neil’s ANTSY. The car turns a corner and w see... a HUGE MEDIA CIRCUS. TV trucks, reporters, fans ca out at Neil’s house. Neil’s jaw goes TIGHT as the car sto

dialogues.speaker: ESCORT
dialogues.text: I’1ll clear a path. The escort opens the door. Neil steps out and is SWARMED. INUNDATED with questions, BLINDED by an ARSENAL of CAMERA PUSH IN on Neil as he presses through it, eyes down... un LITTLE GIRL steps forward. With a model rocket. Neil PAUS

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Would you mind signing it for her? Neil’s eyes TICK from the girl to her father. A beat, the takes the model. The reporters QUIET. One hands him a pen

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Uh, what’s your name?  143.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: ...it’s Katherine. Neil blinks at her. The WONDER in her eyes is oddly DAUNT Awkward, he signs the rocket. But when he hands it back..

dialogues.speaker: MULTIPLE FANS
dialogues.text: (calling out) Can I get an autograph, Neil? / Can I get a picture, Mr. Armstrong? Neil BLANCHES. The calls grow into a ROAR, TAKING US TO -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RIVER of HUMANITY. A huge crowd gathered for the larges TICKER TAPE PARADE we've ever seen. The DIN is DEAFENING New York City - August 13, 1969 Find Neil in an OPEN-TOP CONVERTIBLE with Buzz and Mike. Neil’s eyes have DARK CIRCLES underneath; they DART from crowds on the streets, to the men and women hanging out o building windows, tossing down stacks of IBM punch cards. Buzz and Mike enjoy it more than Neil, but even they seem OVERWHELMED. Off Neil, smile PLASTERED to his face, CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A packed ballroom. Black tie. President Nixon, forty odd Governors, Hollywood Stars and dozens of other dignitarie A gala to end all galas. Everyone GIDDY in anticipation. From BEHIND the empty head table, we see GOVERNOR RONALD REAGAN clink his glass into the mic at the rostrum.

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR REAGAN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Ladies, Gentlemen, I understand our guests of honor have just arrived. If you'll take your seats... As the crowd sits, we PUSH INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, Buzz, Mike and their wives stand, waiting to be introduced. Neil is at the back, SWEATING now.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Who wants a beer? Deke walks in with beers for the men.

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR REAGAN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: How about a California welcome for Command Module Pilot Mike Collins!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE COLLINS
dialogues.text: Put mine on ice, will ya? As Mike heads off, Deke pulls Neil off to one side. Neil stares.

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I got the itinerary. 25 countries?

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: The whole damn world wants to give you guys a hug.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: When can we get back to work?

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: This is work.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Deke. When are we going back up again?

dialogues.speaker: DEKE
dialogues.text: Neil... you’re a symbol now. We can’t risk losing you up there. Realizing that he's permanently grounded.

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR REAGAN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: And now, the man you’ve been waiting for, the first man to walk on the moon, Neil Armstrong! As the crowd breaks out in applause and cheers, Neil, DEVASTATED, walks into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cheers SWELL, PUSH IN on Neil, in front of the cro only now realizing he's made the greatest sacrifice of al As he nods to the crowd, NUMB, the isolation now complete FADE OUT.
